[1402]- Or "that He (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) is the Truth."
[1403]- See footnote of 4:79.

# 4272

Unquestionably, they are in doubt about the meeting with their Lord. Unquestionably He is, of all things, encompassing.

# 4273

Ḥā, Meem.

# 4274

ʿAyn, Seen, Qāf.[1405]

[1405]- See footnote to 2:1.

# 4275

Thus has He revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], and to those before you - Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

# 4276

To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and He is the Most High, the Most Great.[1406]

[1406]- See footnote to 2:255.

# 4277

The heavens almost break from above them,[1407] and the angels exalt [Allāh] with praise of their Lord and ask forgiveness for those on earth. Unquestionably, it is Allāh who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

[1407]- i.e., from the grandeur of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) above them.

# 4278

And those who take as allies other than Him - Allāh is [yet] Guardian over them; and you, [O Muḥammad], are not over them a manager -

# 4279

And thus We have revealed to you an Arabic Qur’ān that you may warn the Mother of Cities [i.e., Makkah] and those around it[1408] and warn of the Day of Assembly, about which there is no doubt. A party will be in Paradise and a party in the Blaze.

[1408]- i.e., all other peoples.

# 4280

And if Allāh willed, He could have made them [of] one religion, but He admits whom He wills[1409] into His mercy. And the wrongdoers have not any protector or helper.

[1409]- i.e., those who desire His guidance and His acceptance of them.

# 4281

Or have they taken protectors [or allies] besides Him? But Allāh - He is the Protector, and He gives life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.

# 4282

And in anything over which you disagree - its ruling is [to be referred] to Allāh. [Say], "That is Allāh, my Lord; upon Him I have relied, and to Him I turn back."[1410]

[1410]- In remembrance and repentance.

# 4283

[He is] Creator of the heavens and the earth. He has made for you from yourselves, mates, and among the cattle, mates; He multiplies you thereby. There is nothing like unto Him,[1411] and He is the Hearing, the Seeing.[1412]

[1411]- There is no similarity whatsoever between the Creator and His creation in essence, in attributes or in deed.
[1412]- See footnotes to 17:1.

# 4284

To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. He extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is, of all things, Knowing.

# 4285

He has ordained for you of religion what He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], and what We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus - to establish the religion and not be divided therein. Difficult for those who associate others with Allāh is that to which you invite them. Allāh chooses for Himself whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him].

# 4286

And they did not become divided until after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And if not for a word[1413] that preceded from your Lord [postponing the penalty] until a specified time, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed, those who were granted inheritance of the Scripture after them are, concerning it, in disquieting doubt.

[1413]- Decree. See footnote to 10:19.

# 4287

So to that [religion of Allāh] invite, [O Muḥammad],[1414] and remain on a right course as you are commanded and do not follow their inclinations but say, "I have believed in what Allāh has revealed of scripture [i.e., the Qur’ān], and I have been commanded to do justice among you. Allāh is our Lord and your Lord. For us are our deeds, and for you your deeds.[1415] There is no [need for] argument between us and you.[1416] Allāh will bring us together, and to Him is the [final] destination."

[1414]- Another meaning understood from the Arabic is "So because of that [division and separation into sects], invite [them back to Allāh]..."
[1415]- i.e., the consequences thereof.
[1416]- Since the truth has been made clear and since those who refuse it do so only out of stubbornness or worldly interests.

# 4288

And those who argue concerning Allāh after He has been responded to[1417] - their argument is invalid with their Lord, and upon them is [His] wrath, and for them is a severe punishment.

[1417]- i.e., after people have accepted the truth from Allāh, in an attempt to turn the believers away from His religion of Islām.

# 4289

It is Allāh who has sent down the Book in truth and [also] the balance [i.e., justice]. And what will make you perceive? Perhaps the Hour is near.

# 4290

Those who do not believe in it are impatient for it,[1418] but those who believe are fearful of it and know that it is the truth. Unquestionably, those who dispute concerning the Hour are in extreme error.

[1418]- They had challenged the Prophet (صلى الله عليه وسلم) to bring it on immediately.

# 4291

Allāh is Subtle[1419] with His servants; He gives provision to whom He wills. And He is the Powerful, the Exalted in Might.

[1419]- See footnote in 12:100.

# 4292

Whoever desires the harvest of the Hereafter - We increase for him in his harvest [i.e., reward]. And whoever desires the harvest [i.e., benefits] of this world - We give him thereof, but there is not for him in the Hereafter any share.

# 4293

Or have they partners [i.e., other deities] who have ordained for them a religion to which Allāh has not consented? But if not for the decisive word,[1420] it would have been concluded between them. And indeed, the wrongdoers will have a painful punishment.

[1420]- Decree. See footnote to 10:19.

# 4294

You will see the wrongdoers fearful of what they have earned, and it will [certainly] befall them. And those who have believed and done righteous deeds will be in lush regions of the gardens [in Paradise] having whatever they will in the presence of their Lord. That is what is the great bounty.

# 4295

It is that of which Allāh gives good tidings to His servants who believe and do righteous deeds. Say, [O Muḥammad], "I do not ask you for it [i.e., this message] any payment [but] only good will through [i.e., due to] kinship." And whoever commits a good deed - We will increase for him good therein. Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Appreciative.[1421]

[1421]- See footnote in 35:30.

# 4296

Or do they say, "He has invented about Allāh a lie"? But if Allāh willed, He could seal over your heart.[1422] And Allāh eliminates falsehood and establishes the truth by His words. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

[1422]- i.e., He could make you forget the Qur’ān and deprive you of it.

# 4297

And it is He who accepts repentance from His servants and pardons misdeeds, and He knows what you do.

# 4298

And He answers [the supplication of] those who have believed and done righteous deeds and increases [for] them from His bounty. But the disbelievers will have a severe punishment.

# 4299

And if Allāh had extended [excessively] provision for His servants, they would have committed tyranny throughout the earth. But He sends [it] down in an amount which He wills. Indeed He is, of His servants, Aware and Seeing.

# 4300

And it is He who sends down the rain after they had despaired and spreads His mercy. And He is the Protector, the Praiseworthy.

# 4301

And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and earth and what He has dispersed throughout them of creatures. And He, for gathering them when He wills, is competent.

# 4302

And whatever strikes you of disaster - it is for what your hands have earned; but He pardons much.

# 4303

And you will not cause failure [to Allāh][1423] upon the earth. And you have not besides Allāh any protector or helper.

[1423]- i.e., escape from Him.

# 4304

And of His signs are the ships in the sea, like mountains.

# 4305

If He willed, He could still the wind, and they would remain motionless on its surface. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

# 4306

Or He could destroy them[1424] for what they earned; but He pardons much.

[1424]- Meaning that Allāh could sink the ships by means of violent winds.

# 4307

And [that is so] those who dispute concerning Our signs may know that for them there is no place of escape.

# 4308

So whatever thing you have been given - it is but [for] enjoyment of the worldly life. But what is with Allāh is better and more lasting for those who have believed and upon their Lord rely

# 4309

And those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, and when they are angry, they forgive,

# 4310

And those who have responded to their Lord and established prayer and whose affair is [determined by] consultation among themselves, and from what We have provided them, they spend,

# 4311

And those who, when tyranny strikes them, they retaliate [in a just manner].[1425]

[1425]- Restoring their rights and not allowing aggressors to take advantage of them out of weakness.

# 4312

And the retribution for an evil act is an evil one like it, but whoever pardons and makes reconciliation - his reward is [due] from Allāh. Indeed, He does not like wrongdoers.

# 4313

And whoever retaliates after having been wronged - those have not upon them any cause [for blame].

# 4314

The cause is only against the ones who wrong the people and tyrannize upon the earth without right. Those will have a painful punishment.

# 4315

And whoever is patient and forgives - indeed, that is of the matters [worthy] of resolve.[1426]

[1426]- On the part of those seeking the reward of Allāh.

# 4316

And he whom Allāh sends astray - for him there is no protector beyond Him. And you will see the wrongdoers, when they see the punishment, saying, "Is there for return [to the former world] any way?"

# 4317

And you will see them being exposed to it [i.e., the Fire], humbled from humiliation, looking from [behind] a covert glance. And those who had believed will say, "Indeed, the [true] losers are the ones who lost themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, the wrongdoers are in an enduring punishment."

# 4318

And there will not be for them any allies to aid them other than Allāh. And whoever Allāh sends astray - for him there is no way.

# 4319

Respond to your Lord before a Day comes from Allāh of which there is no repelling. No refuge will you have that Day, nor for you will there be any denial.[1427]

[1427]- Of your sins or "disapproval" of your punishment.

# 4320

But if they turn away - then We have not sent you, [O Muḥammad], over them as a guardian; upon you is only [the duty of] notification. And indeed, when We let man taste mercy from Us, he rejoices in it; but if evil afflicts him for what his hands have put forth, then indeed, man is ungrateful.

# 4321

To Allāh belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He creates what He wills. He gives to whom He wills female [children], and He gives to whom He wills males.

# 4322

Or He makes them [both] males and females, and He renders whom He wills barren. Indeed, He is Knowing and Competent.

# 4323

And it is not for any human being that Allāh should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a partition or that He sends a messenger [i.e., angel] to reveal, by His permission, what He wills. Indeed, He is Most High and Wise.

# 4324

And thus We have revealed to you an inspiration of Our command [i.e., the Qur’ān]. You did not know what is the Book or [what is] faith, but We have made it a light by which We guide whom We will of Our servants. And indeed, [O Muḥammad], you guide to a straight path -

# 4325

The path of Allāh, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Unquestionably, to Allāh do [all] matters evolve [i.e., return].

# 4326

Ḥā, Meem.[1429]

[1429]- See footnote to 2:1.

# 4327

By the clear Book,

# 4328

Indeed, We have made it an Arabic Qur’ān that you might understand.

# 4329

And indeed it is, in the Mother of the Book[1430] with Us, exalted and full of wisdom.[1431]

[1430]- i.e., the Preserved Slate (al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ).
[1431]- Also, "precise" or "specific."

# 4330

Then should We turn the message away, disregarding you, because you are a transgressing people?

# 4331

And how many a prophet We sent among the former peoples,

# 4332

But there would not come to them a prophet except that they used to ridicule him.

# 4333

And We destroyed greater than them[1432] in [striking] power, and the example of the former peoples has preceded.

[1432]- The disbelievers of the Quraysh, who denied Prophet Muḥammad (صلى الله عليه وسلم).

# 4334

And if you should ask them, "Who has created the heavens and the earth?" they would surely say, "They were created by the Exalted in Might, the Knowing,"

# 4335

[The one] who has made for you the earth a bed and made for you upon it roads that you might be guided

# 4336

And who sends down rain from the sky in measured amounts, and We revive thereby a dead land - thus will you be brought forth -

# 4337

And who created the species, all of them, and has made for you of ships and animals those which you mount

# 4338

That you may settle yourselves upon their backs and then remember the favor of your Lord when you have settled upon them and say, "Exalted is He who has subjected this to us, and we could not have [otherwise] subdued it.[1433]

[1433]- Literally, "made it a companion" or "made it compatible."

# 4339

And indeed we, to our Lord, will [surely] return."

# 4340

But they have attributed to Him from His servants a portion.[1434] Indeed, man is clearly ungrateful.

[1434]- By claiming that He (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) has a son or daughters, as it is said that a child is part of his parent. This concept is totally incompatible with Allāh's unity and exclusiveness.

# 4341

Or has He taken, out of what He has created, daughters and chosen you for [having] sons?

# 4342

And when one of them is given good tidings of that which he attributes to the Most Merciful in comparison [i.e., a daughter], his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.

# 4343

So is one brought up in ornaments while being during conflict unevident[1435] [attributed to Allāh]?

[1435]- Not "obvious" or "distinct" in an argument. Or not "seen," i.e., absent from battles. The reference is to a daughter.

# 4344

And they described the angels, who are servants of the Most Merciful, as females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be recorded, and they will be questioned.

# 4345

And they said, "If the Most Merciful had willed, we would not have worshipped them." They have of that no knowledge. They are not but misjudging.

# 4346

Or have We given them a book before it [i.e., the Qur’ān] to which they are adhering?

# 4347

Rather, they say, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are in their footsteps [rightly] guided."

# 4348

And similarly, We did not send before you any warner into a city except that its affluent said, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are, in their footsteps, following."

# 4349

[Each warner] said, "Even if I brought you better guidance than that [religion] upon which you found your fathers?" They said, "Indeed we, in that with which you were sent, are disbelievers."

# 4350

So We took retribution from them; then see how was the end of the deniers.

# 4351

And [mention, O Muḥammad], when Abraham said to his father and his people, "Indeed, I am disassociated from that which you worship

# 4352

Except for He who created me; and indeed, He will guide me."

# 4353

And he made it[1436] a word remaining among his descendants that they might return [to it].

[1436]- i.e., his testimony that none is worthy of worship except Allāh.

# 4354

However, I gave enjoyment to these [people of Makkah] and their fathers[1437] until there came to them the truth and a clear Messenger.[1438]

[1437]- The descendants of Abraham.
[1438]- i.e., one who is obvious with a clear message, meaning Muḥammad (صلى الله عليه وسلم).

# 4355

But when the truth came to them, they said, "This is magic, and indeed we are, concerning it, disbelievers."

# 4356

And they said, "Why was this Qur’ān not sent down upon a great man from [one of] the two cities?"[1439]

[1439]- Referring to Makkah and aṭ-Ṭā’if.

# 4357

Do they distribute the mercy of your Lord? It is We who have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of this world and have raised some of them above others in degrees [of rank] that they may make use of one another for service. But the mercy of your Lord is better than whatever they accumulate.

# 4358

And if it were not that the people would become one community [of disbelievers],[1440] We would have made for those who disbelieve in the Most Merciful - for their houses - ceilings and stairways of silver upon which to mount.

[1440]- Who assumed that Allāh's generosity to them was a sign of His approval or who would hasten to disbelief in order to obtain wealth.

# 4359

And for their houses - doors and couches [of silver] upon which to recline

# 4360

And gold ornament. But all that is not but the enjoyment of worldly life. And the Hereafter with your Lord is for the righteous.

# 4361

And whoever is blinded from remembrance of the Most Merciful - We appoint for him a devil, and he is to him a companion.

# 4362

And indeed, they [i.e., the devils] avert them from the way [of guidance] while they think that they are [rightly] guided

# 4363

Until, when he comes to Us [at Judgement], he says [to his companion], "How I wish there was between me and you the distance between the east and west; and what a wretched companion."

# 4364

And never will it benefit you that Day, when you have wronged, that you are [all] sharing in the punishment.

# 4365

Then will you make the deaf hear, [O Muḥammad], or guide the blind or he who is in clear error?

# 4366

And whether [or not] We take you away [in death], indeed, We will take retribution upon them.

# 4367

Or whether [or not] We show you that which We have promised them, indeed, We are Perfect in Ability.

# 4368

So adhere to that which is revealed to you. Indeed, you are on a straight path.

# 4369

And indeed, it is a remembrance[1441] for you and your people, and you [all] are going to be questioned.

[1441]- i.e., an honor. Or "a reminder."

# 4370

And ask those We sent before you of Our messengers; have We made besides the Most Merciful deities to be worshipped?

# 4371

And certainly did We send Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, and he said, "Indeed, I am the messenger of the Lord of the worlds."

# 4372

But when he brought them Our signs, at once they laughed at them.

# 4373

And We showed them not a sign except that it was greater than its sister, and We seized them with affliction that perhaps they might return [to faith].

# 4374

And they said [to Moses], "O magician, invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you. Indeed, we will be guided."

# 4375

But when We removed from them the affliction, at once they broke their word.

# 4376

And Pharaoh called out among his people; he said, "O my people, does not the kingdom of Egypt belong to me, and these rivers flowing beneath me; then do you not see?

# 4377

Or am I [not] better than this one [i.e., Moses] who is insignificant and hardly makes himself clear?[1442]

[1442]- That was true previous to his appointment as a prophet, at which time Allāh corrected his speech impediment.

# 4378

Then why have there not been placed upon him bracelets of gold or come with him the angels in conjunction?"

# 4379

So he bluffed his people, and they obeyed him. Indeed, they were [themselves] a people defiantly disobedient [of Allāh].

# 4380

And when they angered Us, We took retribution from them and drowned them all.

# 4381

And We made them a precedent and an example for the later peoples.

# 4382

And when the son of Mary was presented as an example,[1443] immediately your people laughed aloud.

[1443]- Of a creation of Allāh which is being worshipped along with Him.

# 4383

And they said, "Are our gods better, or is he?"[1444] They did not present it [i.e., the comparison] except for [mere] argument. But, [in fact], they are a people prone to dispute.

[1444]- Implying that they must all be the same.

# 4384

He [i.e., Jesus] was not but a servant upon whom We bestowed favor, and We made him an example for the Children of Israel.

# 4385

And if We willed, We could have made [instead] of you angels succeeding [one another][1445] on the earth.

[1445]- Or "succeeding [you]."

# 4386

And indeed, he [i.e., Jesus] will be [a sign for] knowledge of the Hour, so be not in doubt of it, and follow Me.[1446] This is a straight path.

[1446]- i.e., follow the guidance and instruction of Allāh.

# 4387

And never let Satan avert you. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.

# 4388

And when Jesus brought clear proofs, he said, "I have come to you with wisdom [i.e., prophethood] and to make clear to you some of that over which you differ, so fear Allāh and obey me.

# 4389

Indeed, Allāh is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path."

# 4390

But the denominations from among them differed [and separated], so woe to those who have wronged from the punishment of a painful Day.

# 4391

Are they waiting except for the Hour to come upon them suddenly while they perceive not?

# 4392

Close friends, that Day, will be enemies to each other, except for the righteous

# 4393

[To whom Allāh will say], "O My servants, no fear will there be concerning you this Day, nor will you grieve,

# 4394

[You] who believed in Our verses and were Muslims.

# 4395

Enter Paradise, you and your kinds,[1447] delighted."

[1447]- i.e., those like you. Another meaning may be "your spouses," i.e., the righteous among them.

# 4396

Circulated among them will be plates and vessels of gold. And therein is whatever the souls desire and [what] delights the eyes, and you will abide therein eternally.

# 4397

And that is Paradise which you are made to inherit for what you used to do.

# 4398

For you therein is much fruit[1448] from which you will eat.

[1448]- Meaning everything delicious.

# 4399

Indeed, the criminals will be in the punishment of Hell, abiding eternally.

# 4400

It will not be allowed to subside for them, and they, therein, are in despair.

# 4401

And We did not wrong them, but it was they who were the wrongdoers.

# 4402

And they will call, "O Mālik,[1449] let your Lord put an end to us!" He will say, "Indeed, you will remain."

[1449]- Addressing the keeper of Hell.

# 4403

We had certainly brought you the truth, but most of you, to the truth, were averse.

# 4404

Or have they devised [some] affair?[1450] But indeed, We are devising [a plan].

[1450]- Conspiracy against the Prophet (صلى الله عليه وسلم). The reference here is to the disbelievers of Makkah.

# 4405

Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private conversations? Yes, [We do], and Our messengers [i.e., angels] are with them recording.

# 4406

Say, [O Muḥammad], "If the Most Merciful had a son, then I would be the first of [his] worshippers."[1451]

[1451]- Only supposing it were so, which it is not.

# 4407

Exalted is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.

# 4408

So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised.

# 4409

And it is He [i.e., Allāh] who is [the only] deity in the heaven, and on the earth [the only] deity. And He is the Wise, the Knowing.

# 4410

And blessed is He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them and with whom is knowledge of the Hour and to whom you will be returned.

# 4411

And those they invoke[1452] besides Him do not possess [power of] intercession; but only those who testify to the truth [can benefit], and they know.[1453]

[1452]- i.e., worship.
[1453]- That intercession is granted exclusively by permission of Allāh to those He wills.

# 4412

And if you asked them[1454] who created them, they would surely say, "Allāh." So how are they deluded?

[1454]- Those who associate others with Allāh.

# 4413

And [Allāh acknowledges] his saying,[1455] "O my Lord, indeed these are a people who do not believe."

[1455]- i.e., the complaint of Prophet Muḥammad (صلى الله عليه وسلم) about his people.

# 4414

So turn aside from them and say, "Peace."[1456] But they are going to know.

[1456]- Meaning safety or security, i.e., "I will not harm you." This was before permission was granted for armed struggle.

# 4415

Ḥā, Meem.[1458]

[1458]- See footnote to 2:1.

# 4416

By the clear Book,

# 4417

Indeed, We sent it down during a blessed night.[1459] Indeed, We were to warn [mankind].

[1459]- The Night of Decree (Qadr). See Sūrah al-Qadr.

# 4418

Therein [i.e., on that night] is made distinct[1460] every precise matter -

[1460]- Or "is separated" or "apportioned," from what is inscribed in the Preserved Slate. The angels record and descend with whatever Allāh has decreed for the coming year.

# 4419

[Every] matter [proceeding] from Us. Indeed, We were to send [a messenger]

# 4420

As mercy from your Lord. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing,

# 4421

Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them, if you would be certain.

# 4422

There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death. [He is] your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers.

# 4423

But they are in doubt, amusing themselves.

# 4424

Then watch for the Day when the sky will bring a visible smoke

# 4425

Covering the people; this is a painful torment.

# 4426

[They will say], "Our Lord, remove from us the torment; indeed, we are believers."

# 4427

How will there be for them a reminder [at that time]? And there had come to them a clear Messenger.

# 4428

Then they turned away from him and said, "[He was] taught [and is] a madman."

# 4429

Indeed, We will remove the torment for a little. Indeed, you [disbelievers] will return [to disbelief].

# 4430

The Day We will strike with the greatest assault, indeed, We will take retribution.

# 4431

And We had already tried before them the people of Pharaoh, and there came to them a noble messenger [i.e., Moses],

# 4432

[Saying], "Render to me the servants of Allāh.[1461] Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger,"

[1461]- i.e., the Children of Israel.

# 4433

And [saying], "Be not haughty with Allāh. Indeed, I have come to you with clear evidence.

# 4434

And indeed, I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me.[1462]

[1462]- To death. Or "lest you assault me [with your tongues or harm me otherwise]."

# 4435

But if you do not believe me, then leave me alone."

# 4436

And [finally] he called to his Lord that these were a criminal people.

# 4437

[Allāh said], "Then set out with My servants by night. Indeed, you are to be pursued.

# 4438

And leave the sea in stillness.[1463] Indeed, they are an army to be drowned."

[1463]- After it has parted, in order that the soldiers of Pharaoh would follow the Children of Israel and be drowned.

# 4439

How much they left behind of gardens and springs

# 4440

And crops and noble sites

# 4441

And comfort wherein they were amused.

# 4442

Thus. And We caused to inherit it another people.

# 4443

And the heaven and earth wept not for them, nor were they reprieved.

# 4444

And We certainly saved the Children of Israel from the humiliating torment -

# 4445

From Pharaoh. Indeed, he was a haughty one among the transgressors.

# 4446

And We certainly chose them by knowledge over [all] the worlds.

# 4447

And We gave them of signs that in which there was a clear trial.

# 4448

Indeed, these [disbelievers] are saying,

# 4449

"There is not but our first death, and we will not be resurrected.

# 4450

Then bring [back] our forefathers, if you should be truthful."

# 4451

Are they better or the people of Tubbaʿ[1464] and those before them? We destroyed them, [for] indeed, they were criminals.

[1464]- The tribe of Saba’.

# 4452

And We did not create the heavens and earth and that between them in play.

# 4453

We did not create them except in truth, but most of them do not know.

# 4454

Indeed, the Day of Judgement is the appointed time for them all -

# 4455

The Day when no relation[1465] will avail a relation at all, nor will they be helped -

[1465]- i.e., patron, protector or close associate.

# 4456

Except those [believers] on whom Allāh has mercy. Indeed, He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

# 4457

Indeed, the tree of zaqqūm

# 4458

Is food for the sinful.

# 4459

Like murky oil, it boils within bellies

# 4460

Like the boiling of scalding water.

# 4461

[It will be commanded], "Seize him and drag him into the midst of the Hellfire,

# 4462

Then pour over his head from the torment of scalding water."

# 4463

[It will be said], "Taste! Indeed, you are the honored, the noble![1466]

[1466]- As he had claimed upon the earth. He is taunted with these words in Hell as a reminder and additional torment.

# 4464

Indeed, this is what you used to dispute."

# 4465

Indeed, the righteous will be in a secure place:

# 4466

Within gardens and springs,

# 4467

Wearing [garments of] fine silk and brocade, facing each other.

# 4468

Thus. And We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.

# 4469

They will call therein for every [kind of] fruit - safe and secure.

# 4470

They will not taste death therein except the first death, and He will have protected them from the punishment of Hellfire

# 4471

As bounty from your Lord. That is what is the great attainment.

# 4472

And indeed, We have eased it [i.e., the Qur’ān] in your tongue that they might be reminded.

# 4473

So watch, [O Muḥammad]; indeed, they are watching [for your end].

# 4474

Ḥā, Meem.[1468]

[1468]- See footnote to 2:1.

# 4475

The revelation of the Book is from Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

# 4476

Indeed, within the heavens and earth are signs for the believers.

# 4477

And in the creation of yourselves and what He disperses of moving creatures are signs for people who are certain [in faith].

# 4478

And [in] the alternation of night and day and [in] what Allāh sends down from the sky of provision [i.e., rain] and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness and [in His] directing of the winds are signs for a people who reason.

# 4479

These are the verses of Allāh which We recite to you in truth. Then in what statement after Allāh and His verses will they believe?

# 4480

Woe to every sinful liar

# 4481

Who hears the verses of Allāh recited to him, then persists arrogantly as if he had not heard them. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.

# 4482

And when he knows anything of Our verses, he takes them in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment.

# 4483

Before them[1469] is Hell, and what they had earned will not avail them at all nor what they had taken besides Allāh as allies. And they will have a great punishment.

[1469]- See footnote to 14:16.

# 4484

This [Qur’ān] is guidance. And those who have disbelieved in the verses of their Lord will have a painful punishment of foul nature.

# 4485

It is Allāh who subjected to you the sea so that ships may sail upon it by His command and that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.

# 4486

And He has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth - all from Him. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

# 4487

Say, [O Muḥammad], to those who have believed that they [should] forgive those who expect not the days of Allāh [i.e., of His retribution] so that He may recompense a people[1470] for what they used to earn.

[1470]- In the Hereafter, where those who forgive will be rewarded and those who earned evil will be punished. This was at the outset of daʿwah (invitation to Allāh) before permission for jihād.

# 4488

Whoever does a good deed - it is for himself; and whoever does evil - it is against it [i.e., the self or soul]. Then to your Lord you will be returned.

# 4489

And We did certainly give the Children of Israel the Scripture and judgement[1471] and prophethood, and We provided them with good things and preferred them over the worlds.

[1471]- Understanding of the law.

# 4490

And We gave them clear proofs of the matter [of religion]. And they did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

# 4491

Then We put you, [O Muḥammad], on an ordained way concerning the matter [of religion]; so follow it and do not follow the inclinations of those who do not know.

# 4492

Indeed, they will never avail you against Allāh at all. And indeed, the wrongdoers are allies of one another; but Allāh is the protector of the righteous.

# 4493

This [Qur’ān] is enlightenment for mankind and guidance and mercy for a people who are certain [in faith].

# 4494

Or do those who commit evils think We will make them like those who have believed and done righteous deeds - [make them] equal in their life and their death?[1472] Evil is that which they judge [i.e., assume].

[1472]- Another meaning is "...[the evildoers being] equal in their life and their death," i.e., unresponsive to guidance.

# 4495

And Allāh created the heavens and earth in truth and so that every soul may be recompensed for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.

# 4496

Have you seen he who has taken as his god his [own] desire, and Allāh has sent him astray due to knowledge[1473] and has set a seal upon his hearing and his heart and put over his vision a veil? So who will guide him after Allāh? Then will you not be reminded?

[1473]- This can refer to Allāh's knowledge of that person and of his preference for his own inclinations or to that person's knowledge of the truth while he refuses it.

# 4497

And they say, "There is not but our worldly life; we die and live,[1474] and nothing destroys us except time." And they have of that no knowledge; they are only assuming.

[1474]- i.e., some people die and others live, replacing them.

# 4498

And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, their argument is only that they say, "Bring [back] our forefathers, if you should be truthful."

# 4499

Say, "Allāh causes you to live, then causes you to die; then He will assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt, but most of the people do not know."

# 4500

And to Allāh belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And the Day the Hour appears - that Day the falsifiers will lose.

# 4501

And you will see every nation kneeling [from fear]. Every nation will be called to its record [and told], "Today you will be recompensed for what you used to do.

# 4502

This, Our record, speaks about you in truth. Indeed, We were having transcribed[1475] whatever you used to do."

[1475]- By recording angels.

# 4503

So as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is what is the clear attainment.

# 4504

But as for those who disbelieved, [it will be said], "Were not Our verses recited to you, but you were arrogant and became a criminal people?

# 4505

And when it was said, 'Indeed, the promise of Allāh is truth and the Hour [is coming] - no doubt about it,' you said, 'We know not what is the Hour. We assume only assumption, and we are not convinced.'"

# 4506

And the evil consequences of what they did will appear to them, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

# 4507

And it will be said, "Today We will forget you as you forgot the meeting of this Day of yours, and your refuge is the Fire, and for you there are no helpers.

# 4508

That is because you took the verses of Allāh in ridicule, and worldly life deluded you." So that Day they will not be removed from it, nor will they be asked to appease [Allāh].

# 4509

Then, to Allāh belongs [all] praise - Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of the worlds.

# 4510

And to Him belongs [all] grandeur within the heavens and the earth, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

# 4511

Ḥā, Meem.[1477]

[1477]- See footnote to 2:1.

# 4512

The revelation of the Book is from Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

# 4513

We did not create the heavens and earth and what is between them except in truth and [for] a specified term. But those who disbelieve, from that of which they are warned, are turning away.

# 4514

Say, [O Muḥammad], "Have you considered that which you invoke besides Allāh? Show me what they have created of the earth; or did they have partnership in [creation of] the heavens? Bring me a scripture [revealed] before this or a [remaining] trace of knowledge, if you should be truthful."

# 4515

And who is more astray than he who invokes besides Allāh those who will not respond to him until the Day of Resurrection [i.e., never], and they, of their invocation, are unaware.

# 4516

And when the people are gathered [that Day], they [who were invoked] will be enemies to them, and they will be deniers of their worship.

# 4517

And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is obvious magic."

# 4518

Or do they say, "He has invented it"? Say, "If I have invented it, you will not possess for me [the power of protection] from Allāh at all. He is most knowing of that in which you are involved.[1478] Sufficient is He as Witness between me and you, and He is the Forgiving, the Merciful."

[1478]- Of false implications and suggestions.

# 4519

Say, "I am not something new among the messengers,[1479] nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I only follow that which is revealed to me, and I am not but a clear warner."

[1479]- i.e., I am neither the first messenger to be sent, nor do I bring something different from the other messengers.

# 4520

Say, "Have you considered: if it [i.e., the Qur’ān] was from Allāh, and you disbelieved in it while a witness from the Children of Israel has testified to something similar[1480] and believed while you were arrogant...?"[1481] Indeed, Allāh does not guide the wrongdoing people.

[1480]- Based upon information from the Torah.
[1481]- The conclusion is estimated to be "...would you not then be the most unjust of people?" or "...in what condition would you then be?"

# 4521

And those who disbelieve say of those who believe, "If it had [truly] been good, they would not have preceded us to it." And when they are not guided by it, they will say, "This is an ancient falsehood."

# 4522

And before it was the scripture of Moses to lead and as a mercy. And this is a confirming Book in an Arabic tongue to warn those who have wronged and as good tidings to the doers of good.

# 4523

Indeed, those who have said, "Our Lord is Allāh," and then remained on a right course - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

# 4524

Those are the companions of Paradise, abiding eternally therein as reward for what they used to do.

# 4525

And We have enjoined upon man, to his parents, good treatment. His mother carried him with hardship and gave birth to him with hardship, and his gestation and weaning [period] is thirty months. [He grows] until, when he reaches maturity and reaches [the age of] forty years, he says, "My Lord, enable me[1482] to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to work righteousness of which You will approve and make righteous for me my offspring. Indeed, I have repented to You, and indeed, I am of the Muslims."

[1482]- Literally, "gather within me the utmost strength and ability."

# 4526

Those are the ones from whom We will accept the best of what they did and overlook their misdeeds, [their being] among the companions of Paradise. [That is] the promise of truth which they had been promised.

# 4527

But one who says to his parents, "Uff[1483] to you; do you promise me that I will be brought forth [from the earth] when generations before me have already passed on [into oblivion]?" while they call to Allāh for help [and to their son], "Woe to you! Believe! Indeed, the promise of Allāh is truth." But he says, "This is not but legends of the former peoples" -

[1483]- An expression of distaste and irritation.

# 4528

Those are the ones upon whom the word [i.e., decree] has come into effect, [who will be] among nations which had passed on before them of jinn and men. Indeed, they [all] were losers.

# 4529

And for all there are degrees [of reward and punishment] for what they have done, and [it is] so that He may fully compensate them for their deeds, and they will not be wronged.

# 4530

And the Day those who disbelieved are exposed to the Fire [it will be said], "You exhausted your pleasures during your worldly life and enjoyed them, so this Day you will be awarded the punishment of [extreme] humiliation because you were arrogant upon the earth without right and because you were defiantly disobedient."

# 4531

And mention, [O Muḥammad], the brother of ʿAad,[1484] when he warned his people in [the region of] al-Aḥqāf - and warners had already passed on before him and after him - [saying], "Do not worship except Allāh. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."[1485]

[1484]- i.e., the prophet Hūd.
[1485]- Upon the earth. It could also refer to "a tremendous Day," i.e., that of resurrection.

# 4532

They said, "Have you come to delude us away from our gods? Then bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the truthful."

# 4533

He said, "Knowledge [of its time] is only with Allāh, and I convey to you that with which I was sent; but I see you [to be] a people behaving ignorantly."

# 4534

And when they saw it as a cloud approaching their valleys, they said, "This is a cloud bringing us rain!" Rather, it is that for which you were impatient:[1486] a wind, within it a painful punishment,

[1486]- When you challenged your prophet. See verse 22 of this sūrah.

# 4535

Destroying everything by command of its Lord. And they became so that nothing was seen [of them] except their dwellings. Thus do We recompense the criminal people.

# 4536

And We had certainly established them in such as We have not established you, and We made for them hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect]. But their hearing and vision and hearts availed them not from anything [of the punishment] when they were [continually] rejecting the signs of Allāh; and they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

# 4537

And We have already destroyed what surrounds you of [those] cities, and We have diversified the signs [or verses] that perhaps they might return [from disbelief].

# 4538

Then why did those they took besides Allāh as deities by which to approach [Him][1487] not aid them? But they had strayed [i.e., departed] from them. And that was their falsehood and what they were inventing.

[1487]- According to their claim.

# 4539

And [mention, O Muḥammad], when We directed to you a few of the jinn, listening to the Qur’ān. And when they attended it, they said, "Listen attentively." And when it was concluded, they went back to their people as warners.

# 4540

They said, "O our people, indeed we have heard a [recited] Book revealed after Moses confirming what was before it which guides to the truth and to a straight path.

# 4541

O our people, respond to the Caller [i.e., Messenger] of Allāh[1488] and believe in him; He [i.e., Allāh] will forgive for you your sins and protect you from a painful punishment.

[1488]- Prophet Muḥammad (صلى الله عليه وسلم).

# 4542

But he who does not respond to the Caller of Allāh will not cause failure [to Him] upon earth, and he will not have besides Him any protectors. Those are in manifest error."

# 4543

Do they not see that Allāh, who created the heavens and earth and did not fail in their creation, is able to give life to the dead? Yes. Indeed, He is over all things competent.

# 4544

And the Day those who disbelieved are exposed to the Fire [it will be said], "Is this not the truth?" They will say, "Yes, by our Lord." He will say, "Then taste the punishment for what you used to deny."[1489]

[1489]- Or "because you used to disbelieve."

# 4545

So be patient, [O Muḥammad], as were those of determination among the messengers and do not be impatient for them.[1490] It will be - on the Day they see that which they are promised - as though they had not remained [in the world] except an hour of a day. [This is] notification. And will [any] be destroyed except the defiantly disobedient people?

[1490]- i.e., for Allāh's punishment of the disbelievers.

# 4546

Those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allāh - He will waste their deeds.[1492]

[1492]- i.e., cause them to be lost or make them worthless, earning no reward.

# 4547

And those who believe and do righteous deeds and believe in what has been sent down upon Muḥammad - and it is the truth from their Lord - He will remove from them their misdeeds and amend their condition.

# 4548

That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehood, and those who believe follow the truth from their Lord. Thus does Allāh present to the people their comparisons.[1493]

[1493]- So that they may know the results of their choice.

# 4549

So when you meet those who disbelieve [in battle], strike [their] necks until, when you have inflicted slaughter upon them, then secure [their] bonds,[1494] and either [confer] favor[1495] afterwards or ransom [them] until the war lays down its burdens.[1496] That [is the command]. And if Allāh had willed, He could have taken vengeance upon them [Himself], but [He ordered armed struggle] to test some of you by means of others. And those who are killed in the cause of Allāh - never will He waste their deeds.

[1494]- i.e., take those remaining as captives.
[1495]- i.e., release them without ransom.
[1496]- i.e., its armor, machinery, etc., meaning "until the war is over."

# 4550

He will guide them and amend their condition

# 4551

And admit them to Paradise, which He has made known to them.

# 4552

O you who have believed, if you support Allāh, He will support you and plant firmly your feet.

# 4553

But those who disbelieve - for them is misery, and He will waste their deeds.

# 4554

That is because they disliked what Allāh revealed, so He rendered worthless their deeds.

# 4555

Have they not traveled through the land and seen how was the end of those before them? Allāh destroyed [everything] over them,[1497] and for the disbelievers is something comparable.

[1497]- i.e., destroyed them and all they owned.

# 4556

That is because Allāh is the protector of those who have believed and because the disbelievers have no protector.

# 4557

Indeed, Allāh will admit those who have believed and done righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow, but those who disbelieve enjoy themselves and eat as grazing livestock eat, and the Fire will be a residence for them.

# 4558

And how many a city was stronger than your city [i.e., Makkah] which drove you out? We destroyed them; and there was no helper for them.

# 4559

So is he who is on clear evidence from his Lord like him to whom the evil of his work has been made attractive and they follow their [own] desires?

# 4560

Is the description of Paradise, which the righteous are promised, wherein are rivers of water unaltered,[1498] rivers of milk the taste of which never changes, rivers of wine delicious to those who drink, and rivers of purified honey, in which they will have from all [kinds of] fruits and forgiveness from their Lord... [Are its inhabitants] like those who abide eternally in the Fire and are given to drink scalding water that will sever their intestines?

[1498]- In taste or smell, neither stagnant nor polluted.

# 4561

And among them, [O Muḥammad], are those who listen to you, until when they depart from you, they say to those who were given knowledge,[1499] "What has he said just now?" Those are the ones of whom Allāh has sealed over their hearts and who have followed their [own] desires.

[1499]- From among the Prophet's companions.

# 4562

And those who are guided - He increases them in guidance and gives them their righteousness.[1500]

[1500]- Taqwā, meaning piety, consciousness and fear of Allāh, and care to avoid His displeasure.

# 4563

Then do they await except that the Hour should come upon them unexpectedly? But already there have come [some of] its indications. Then how [i.e., what good] to them, when it has come, will be their remembrance?

# 4564

So know, [O Muḥammad], that there is no deity except Allāh and ask forgiveness for your sin[1501] and for the believing men and believing women. And Allāh knows of your movement and your resting place.

[1501]- See footnote to 40:55.

# 4565

Those who believe say, "Why has a sūrah[1502] not been sent down?" But when a precise sūrah is revealed and battle is mentioned therein, you see those in whose hearts is disease [i.e., hypocrisy] looking at you with a look of one overcome by death. And more appropriate for them[1503] [would have been]

[1502]- i.e., one in which permission is given the believers to fight their enemies.
[1503]- The words "awlā lahum" can also be interpreted as "woe to them!" In that case, the following verse would begin, "[Better for them would have been] obedience and good words."

# 4566

Obedience and good words. And when the matter [of fighting] was determined, if they had been true to Allāh, it would have been better for them.

# 4567

So would you perhaps, if you turned away,[1504] cause corruption on earth and sever your [ties of] relationship?

[1504]- From Islām or from jihād (struggling in the cause of Allāh).

# 4568

Those [who do so] are the ones that Allāh has cursed, so He deafened them and blinded their vision.

# 4569

Then do they not reflect upon the Qur’ān, or are there locks upon [their] hearts?

# 4570

Indeed, those who reverted back [to disbelief] after guidance had become clear to them - Satan enticed them and prolonged hope for them.

# 4571

That is because they said to those who disliked what Allāh sent down,[1505] "We will obey you in part of the matter." And Allāh knows what they conceal.

[1505]- i.e., the Jews of Madīnah.

# 4572

Then how [will it be] when the angels take them in death, striking their faces and their backs?

# 4573

That is because they followed what angered Allāh and disliked [what earns] His pleasure, so He rendered worthless their deeds.

# 4574

Or do those in whose hearts is disease think that Allāh would never expose their [feelings of] hatred?

# 4575

And if We willed, We could show them to you, and you would know them by their mark; but you will surely know them by the tone of [their] speech. And Allāh knows your deeds.

# 4576

And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allāh] and the patient, and We will test your affairs.

# 4577

Indeed, those who disbelieved and averted [people] from the path of Allāh and opposed the Messenger after guidance had become clear to them - never will they harm Allāh at all, and He will render worthless their deeds.

# 4578

O you who have believed, obey Allāh and obey the Messenger and do not invalidate your deeds.

# 4579

Indeed, those who disbelieved and averted [people] from the path of Allāh and then died while they were disbelievers - never will Allāh forgive them.

# 4580

So do not weaken and call for peace while you are superior; and Allāh is with you and will never deprive you of [the reward of] your deeds.

# 4581

[This] worldly life is only amusement and diversion. And if you believe and fear Allāh, He will give you your rewards and not ask you for your properties.

# 4582

If He should ask you for them and press you, you would withhold, and He would expose your hatred [i.e., unwillingness].

# 4583

Here you are - those invited to spend in the cause of Allāh - but among you are those who withhold [out of greed]. And whoever withholds only withholds [benefit] from himself; and Allāh is the Free of need, while you are the needy. And if you turn away [i.e., refuse], He will replace you with another people; then they will not be the likes of you.

# 4584

Indeed, We have given you, [O Muḥammad], a clear conquest[1507]

[1507]- Ibn Masʿūd said, "You [people] consider the conquest to be that of Makkah, but we consider it to be the Treaty of al-Ḥudaybiyyah." Al-Bukhārī reported a similar quotation from al-Barā’ bin ʿĀzib. Although initially regarded by the companions as a setback, the treaty, in effect, served to promote the spread of Islām, which led to the conquest of Makkah two years later.

# 4585

That Allāh may forgive for you what preceded of your sin [i.e., errors] and what will follow and complete His favor upon you and guide you to a straight path

# 4586

And [that] Allāh may aid you with a mighty victory.

# 4587

It is He who sent down tranquility into the hearts of the believers that they would increase in faith along with their [present] faith. And to Allāh belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth, and ever is Allāh Knowing and Wise.

# 4588

[And] that He may admit the believing men and the believing women to gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein eternally and remove from them their misdeeds - and ever is that, in the sight of Allāh, a great attainment –

# 4589

And [that] He may punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women, and the polytheist men and polytheist women - those who assume about Allāh an assumption of evil nature. Upon them is a misfortune of evil nature; and Allāh has become angry with them and has cursed them and prepared for them Hell, and evil it is as a destination.

# 4590

And to Allāh belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth. And ever is Allāh Exalted in Might and Wise.

# 4591

Indeed, We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner

# 4592

That you [people] may believe in Allāh and His Messenger and honor him and respect him [i.e., the Prophet (صلى الله عليه وسلم)] and exalt Him [i.e., Allāh] morning and afternoon.

# 4593

Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to you, [O Muḥammad] - they are actually pledging allegiance to Allāh. The hand[1508] of Allāh is over their hands.[1509] So he who breaks his word only breaks it to the detriment of himself. And he who fulfills that which he has promised Allāh - He will give him a great reward.

[1508]- See footnote to 2:19.
[1509]- Meaning that He (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) accepted their pledge.

# 4594

Those who remained behind[1510] of the bedouins will say to you, "Our properties and our families occupied us, so ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not within their hearts. Say, "Then who could prevent Allāh at all if He intended for you harm or intended for you benefit? Rather, ever is Allāh, of what you do, Aware.

[1510]- See footnote to 9:81.

# 4595

But you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, ever, and that was made pleasing in your hearts. And you assumed an assumption of evil and became a people ruined."

# 4596

And whoever has not believed in Allāh and His Messenger - then indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers a Blaze.

# 4597

And to Allāh belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And ever is Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.

# 4598

Those who remained[1511] behind will say when you set out toward the war booty to take it, "Let us follow you." They wish to change the words of Allāh. Say, "Never will you follow us. Thus did Allāh say before." So they will say, "Rather, you envy us." But [in fact] they were not understanding except a little.[1512]

[1511]- See footnote to 9:81.
[1512]- i.e., they only understood the material aspects of life.

# 4599

Say to those who remained behind of the bedouins, "You will be called to [face] a people of great military might; you may fight them, or they will submit.[1513] So if you obey, Allāh will give you a good reward; but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment."

[1513]- To Allāh in Islām.

# 4600

There is not upon the blind any guilt or upon the lame any guilt or upon the ill any guilt [for remaining behind]. And whoever obeys Allāh and His Messenger - He will admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow; but whoever turns away - He will punish him with a painful punishment.

# 4601

Certainly was Allāh pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you, [O Muḥammad], under the tree, and He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquility upon them and rewarded them with an imminent conquest[1514]

[1514]- That of Khaybar, which preceded the conquest of Makkah.

# 4602

And much war booty which they will take. And ever is Allāh Exalted in Might and Wise.

# 4603

Allāh has promised you much booty that you will take [in the future] and has hastened for you this [victory] and withheld the hands of people from you - that it may be a sign for the believers and [that] He may guide you to a straight path.

# 4604

And [He promises] other [victories] that you were [so far] unable to [realize] which Allāh has already encompassed.[1515] And ever is Allāh, over all things, competent.

[1515]- i.e., prepared for you or decreed.

# 4605

And if those [Makkans] who disbelieve had fought you, they would have turned their backs [in flight]. Then they would not find a protector or a helper.

# 4606

[This is] the established way of Allāh which has occurred before. And never will you find in the way of Allāh any change.

# 4607

And it is He who withheld their hands from you and your hands from them within [the area of] Makkah after He caused you to overcome them. And ever is Allāh, of what you do, Seeing.

# 4608

They are the ones who disbelieved and obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Ḥarām while the offering[1516] was prevented from reaching its place of sacrifice. And if not for believing men and believing women whom you did not know - that you might trample [i.e., kill] them and there would befall you because of them dishonor without [your] knowledge - [you would have been permitted to enter Makkah]. [This was so] that Allāh might admit to His mercy whom He willed. If they had been apart [from them], We would have punished those who disbelieved among them with painful punishment

[1516]- i.e., seventy camels intended for sacrifice and feeding of the poor.

# 4609

When those who disbelieved had put into their hearts chauvinism - the chauvinism of the time of ignorance. But Allāh sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger and upon the believers and imposed upon them the word of righteousness, and they were more deserving of it and worthy of it. And ever is Allāh, of all things, Knowing.

# 4610

Certainly has Allāh showed to His Messenger the vision [i.e., dream] in truth. You will surely enter al-Masjid al-Ḥarām, if Allāh wills, in safety, with your heads shaved and [hair] shortened,[1517] not fearing [anyone]. He knew what you did not know and has arranged before that a conquest near [at hand].

[1517]- i.e., having completed the rites of ʿumrah.

# 4611

It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion. And sufficient is Allāh as Witness.

# 4612

Muḥammad is the Messenger of Allāh; and those with him are forceful against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating [in prayer], seeking bounty from Allāh and [His] pleasure. Their sign is in their faces from the effect of prostration [i.e., prayer]. That is their description in the Torah. And their description in the Gospel is as a plant which produces its offshoots and strengthens them so they grow firm and stand upon their stalks, delighting the sowers - so that He [i.e., Allāh] may enrage by them[1518] the disbelievers. Allāh has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds among them forgiveness and a great reward.

[1518]- The given examples depict the Prophet (صلى الله عليه وسلم) and his companions.

# 4613

O you who have believed, do not put [yourselves] before Allāh and His Messenger[1520] but fear Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is Hearing and Knowing.

[1520]- Rather, wait for instruction and follow the way of the Prophet (صلى الله عليه وسلم).

# 4614

O you who have believed, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet or be loud to him in speech like the loudness of some of you to others, lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not.

# 4615

Indeed, those who lower their voices before the Messenger of Allāh - they are the ones whose hearts Allāh has tested for righteousness. For them is forgiveness and great reward.

# 4616

Indeed, those who call you, [O Muḥammad], from behind the chambers - most of them do not use reason.

# 4617

And if they had been patient until you [could] come out to them, it would have been better for them. But Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

# 4618

O you who have believed, if there comes to you a disobedient one with information, investigate, lest you harm a people out of ignorance and become, over what you have done, regretful.

# 4619

And know that among you is the Messenger of Allāh. If he were to obey you in much of the matter, you would be in difficulty, but Allāh has endeared to you the faith and has made it pleasing in your hearts and has made hateful to you disbelief, defiance and disobedience. Those are the [rightly] guided.

# 4620

[It is] as bounty from Allāh and favor. And Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

# 4621

And if two factions among the believers should fight, then make settlement between the two. But if one of them oppresses the other, then fight against the one that oppresses until it returns to the ordinance of Allāh. And if it returns, then make settlement between them in justice and act justly. Indeed, Allāh loves those who act justly.

# 4622

The believers are but brothers, so make settlement between your brothers. And fear Allāh that you may receive mercy.

# 4623

O you who have believed, let not a people ridicule [another] people; perhaps they may be better than them; nor let women ridicule [other] women; perhaps they may be better than them. And do not insult one another and do not call each other by [offensive] nicknames. Wretched is the name [i.e., mention] of disobedience after [one's] faith. And whoever does not repent - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.

# 4624

O you who have believed, avoid much [negative] assumption. Indeed, some assumption is sin. And do not spy or backbite each other. Would one of you like to eat the flesh of his brother when dead? You would detest it. And fear Allāh; indeed, Allāh is Accepting of Repentance and Merciful.

# 4625

O mankind, indeed We have created you from male and female and made you peoples and tribes that you may know one another. Indeed, the most noble of you in the sight of Allāh is the most righteous[1521] of you. Indeed, Allāh is Knowing and Aware.

[1521]- Literally, "he who has the most taqwā," i.e., consciousness and fear of Allāh, piety and righteousness.

# 4626

The bedouins say, "We have believed." Say, "You have not [yet] believed; but say [instead], 'We have submitted,' for faith has not yet entered your hearts. And if you obey Allāh and His Messenger, He will not deprive you from your deeds[1522] of anything. Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful."

[1522]- i.e., the reward thereof.

# 4627

The believers are only the ones who have believed in Allāh and His Messenger and then doubt not but strive with their properties and their lives in the cause of Allāh. It is those who are the truthful.

# 4628

Say, "Would you acquaint Allāh with your religion while Allāh knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and Allāh is Knowing of all things?"

# 4629

They consider it a favor to you that they have accepted Islām. Say, "Do not consider your Islām a favor to me. Rather, Allāh has conferred favor upon you that He has guided you to the faith, if you should be truthful."

# 4630

Indeed, Allāh knows the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And Allāh is Seeing of what you do.

# 4631

Qāf.[1524] By the honored Qur’ān...[1525]

[1524]- See footnote to 2:1.
[1525]- See footnote to 38:1.

# 4632

But they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves, and the disbelievers say, "This is an amazing thing.

# 4633

When we have died and have become dust, [we will return to life]? That is a distant [i.e., unlikely] return."

# 4634

We know what the earth diminishes [i.e., consumes] of them, and with Us is a retaining record.

# 4635

But they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are in a confused condition.

# 4636

Have they not looked at the heaven above them - how We structured it and adorned it and [how] it has no rifts?

# 4637

And the earth - We spread it out and cast therein firmly set mountains and made grow therein [something] of every beautiful kind,

# 4638

Giving insight and a reminder for every servant who turns [to Allāh].

# 4639

And We have sent down blessed rain from the sky and made grow thereby gardens and grain from the harvest

# 4640

And lofty palm trees having fruit arranged in layers -

# 4641

As provision for the servants, and We have given life thereby to a dead land. Thus is the emergence [i.e., resurrection].

# 4642

The people of Noah denied before them,[1526] and the companions of the well[1527] and Thamūd

[1526]- i.e., before the disbelievers of Makkah.
[1527]- See footnote to 25:38.

# 4643

And ʿAad and Pharaoh and the brothers [i.e., people] of Lot

# 4644

And the companions of the thicket and the people of Tubbaʿ. All denied the messengers, so My threat was justly fulfilled.

# 4645

Did We fail in the first creation? But they are in confusion over a new creation.

# 4646

And We have already created man and know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer[1528] to him than [his] jugular vein.

[1528]- In absolute knowledge of everything about him. "We" has also been interpreted to mean the angels who are mentioned in the following verse.

# 4647

When the two receivers [i.e., recording angels] receive,[1529] seated on the right and on the left.

[1529]- And record each word and deed.

# 4648

He [i.e., man] utters no word except that with him is an observer prepared [to record].

# 4649

And the intoxication of death will bring the truth; that is what you were trying to avoid.

# 4650

And the Horn will be blown. That is the Day of [carrying out] the threat.

# 4651

And every soul will come, with it a driver and a witness.[1530]

[1530]- i.e., one angel driving the soul to the Judgement and one to testify as to its deeds.

# 4652

[It will be said], "You were certainly in unmindfulness of this, and We have removed from you your cover,[1531] so your sight, this Day, is sharp."

[1531]- Of heedlessness, or that which had sealed your hearing, your vision and your heart from guidance.

# 4653

And his companion, [the angel], will say, "This [record] is what is with me, prepared."

# 4654

[Allāh will say], "Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever,

# 4655

Preventer of good, aggressor, and doubter,

# 4656

Who made [as equal] with Allāh another deity; then throw him into the severe punishment."

# 4657

His [devil] companion will say, "Our Lord, I did not make him transgress, but he [himself] was in extreme error."

# 4658

[Allāh] will say, "Do not dispute before Me, while I had already presented to you the threat [i.e., warning].

# 4659

The word [i.e., decree] will not be changed with Me, and never will I be unjust to the servants."

# 4660

On the Day We will say to Hell, "Have you been filled?" and it will say, "Are there some more,"

# 4661

And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, not far,

# 4662

[It will be said], "This is what you were promised - for every returner [to Allāh] and keeper [of His covenant].

# 4663

Who feared the Most Merciful in the unseen and came with a heart returning [in repentance].

# 4664

Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Eternity."

# 4665

They will have whatever they wish therein, and with Us is more.

# 4666

And how many a generation before them did We destroy who were greater than them in [striking] power and had explored throughout the lands. Is there any place of escape?

# 4667

Indeed in that is a reminder for whoever has a heart or who listens while he is present [in mind].

# 4668

And We did certainly create the heavens and earth and what is between them in six days, and there touched Us no weariness.

# 4669

So be patient, [O Muḥammad], over what they say and exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting,

# 4670

And [in part] of the night exalt Him and after prostration [i.e., prayer].

# 4671

And listen on the Day when the Caller[1532] will call out from a place that is near -

[1532]- An angel who will call out Allāh's command for the Resurrection.

# 4672

The Day they will hear the blast [of the Horn] in truth. That is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].

# 4673

Indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is the destination

# 4674

On the Day the earth breaks away from them [and they emerge] rapidly; that is a gathering easy for Us.

# 4675

We are most knowing of what they say, and you are not over them a tyrant.[1533] But remind by the Qur’ān whoever fears My threat.

[1533]- Forcing people to belief or submission.

# 4676

By the [winds] scattering [dust], dispersing [it]

# 4677

And the [clouds] carrying a load [of water]

# 4678

And the ships sailing with ease

# 4679

And the [angels] apportioning [each] matter,

# 4680

Indeed, what you are promised is true.

# 4681

And indeed, the recompense is to occur.

# 4682

By the heaven containing pathways,[1535]

[1535]- Explained as tracks, layers or orbits.

# 4683

Indeed, you are in differing speech.[1536]

[1536]- About Prophet Muḥammad (صلى الله عليه وسلم) and the Qur’ān.

# 4684

Deluded away from it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is he who is deluded.

# 4685

Destroyed are the misinformers[1537]

[1537]- Or "May they be destroyed" or "cursed."

# 4686

Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.

# 4687

They ask, "When is the Day of Recompense?"

# 4688

[It is] the Day they will be tormented over the Fire

# 4689

[And will be told], "Taste your torment. This is that for which you were impatient."

# 4690

Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs,

# 4691

Accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good.

# 4692

They used to sleep but little of the night,[1538]

[1538]- i.e., spending a portion of the night in prayer and supplication.

# 4693

And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness,

# 4694

And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.

# 4695

And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]

# 4696

And in yourselves. Then will you not see?

# 4697

And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.

# 4698

Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is truth - just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.

# 4699

Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham?[1539] -

[1539]- Who were angels given honored positions by Allāh.

# 4700

When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace; [you are] a people unknown."

# 4701

Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf.

# 4702

And placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"

# 4703

And he felt from them apprehension.[1540] They said, "Fear not," and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.

[1540]- See footnote to 11:70.

# 4704

And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said, "[I am] a barren old woman!"

# 4705

They said, "Thus has said your Lord; indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."

# 4706

[Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

# 4707

They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals[1541]

[1541]- i.e., those who defied Lot (upon him be peace).

# 4708

To send down upon them stones of clay,

# 4709

Marked in the presence of your Lord for the transgressors."

# 4710

So We brought out whoever was in them [i.e., the cities] of the believers.

# 4711

And We found not within them other than a [single] house of Muslims.[1542]

[1542]- i.e., Lot and his family, excepting his wife.

# 4712

And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.

# 4713

And in Moses [was a sign], when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.[1543]

[1543]- i.e., evidences.

# 4714

But he turned away with his supporters and said, "A magician or a madman."

# 4715

So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea, and he was blameworthy.

# 4716

And in ʿAad [was a sign], when We sent against them the barren wind.[1544]

[1544]- Barren of any benefit, i.e., evil.

# 4717

It left nothing of what it came upon but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.

# 4718

And in Thamūd, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a time."

# 4719

But they were insolent toward the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.

# 4720

And they were unable to arise, nor could they defend themselves.

# 4721

And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before; indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.

# 4722

And the heaven We constructed with strength,[1545] and indeed, We are [its] expander.

[1545]- Literally, "hands."

# 4723

And the earth We have spread out, and excellent is the preparer.

# 4724

And of all things We created two mates [i.e., counterparts]; perhaps you will remember.

# 4725

So flee to Allāh.[1546] Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

[1546]- i.e., turn to Allāh and take refuge in Him from disbelief and sin, thereby escaping His punishment.

# 4726

And do not make [as equal] with Allāh another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

# 4727

Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."

# 4728

Did they suggest it to them?[1547] Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people.

[1547]- i.e., Did the former disbelievers pass on these words to the Makkans so that they repeat the same expressions?

# 4729

So leave them, [O Muḥammad], for you are not to be blamed.

# 4730

And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers.

# 4731

And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.

# 4732

I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.

# 4733

Indeed, it is Allāh who is the [continual] Provider,[1548] the firm possessor of strength.

[1548]- Providing everything required by His creations during their decreed existence. His provision includes guidance.

# 4734

And indeed, for those who have wronged is a portion [of punishment] like the portion of their companions [i.e., predecessors], so let them not impatiently urge Me.

# 4735

And woe to those who have disbelieved from their Day which they are promised.

# 4736

By the mount

# 4737

And [by] a Book inscribed[1550]

[1550]- Interpreted as the Preserved Slate or possibly the Qur’ān.

# 4738

In parchment spread open

# 4739

And [by] the frequented House[1551]

[1551]- The house of worship for the angels in the seventh heaven, comparable to the Kaʿbah on earth.

# 4740

And [by] the ceiling [i.e., heaven] raised high

# 4741

And [by] the sea set on fire,[1552]

[1552]- On the Day of Resurrection. Or "the sea which has overflowed."

# 4742

Indeed, the punishment of your Lord will occur.

# 4743

Of it there is no preventer.

# 4744

On the Day the heaven will sway with circular motion

# 4745

And the mountains will pass on, departing[1553] -

[1553]- Becoming dust and moving as clouds.

# 4746

Then woe, that Day, to the deniers,

# 4747

Who are in [empty] discourse amusing themselves.

# 4748

The Day they are thrust toward the fire of Hell with a [violent] thrust, [its angels will say],

# 4749

"This is the Fire which you used to deny.

# 4750

Then is this magic, or do you not see?

# 4751

[Enter to] burn therein; then be patient or impatient - it is all the same for you. You are only being recompensed [for] what you used to do."

# 4752

Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and pleasure,

# 4753

Enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of Hellfire.

# 4754

[They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."

# 4755

They will be reclining on thrones lined up, and We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.

# 4756

And those who believed and whose descendants followed them in faith - We will join with them their descendants, and We will not deprive them of anything of their deeds.[1554] Every person, for what he earned, is retained.[1555]

[1554]- i.e., the reward thereof.
[1555]- i.e., subject or held responsible. Literally, "a hostage."

# 4757

And We will provide them with fruit and meat from whatever they desire.

# 4758

They will exchange with one another a cup [of wine] wherein [results] no ill speech or commission of sin.

# 4759

There will circulate among them [servant] boys [especially] for them, as if they were pearls well-protected.

# 4760

And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.

# 4761

They will say, "Indeed, we were previously among our people fearful [of displeasing Allāh].

# 4762

So Allāh conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.

# 4763

Indeed, we used to supplicate[1556] Him before. Indeed, it is He who is the Beneficent, the Merciful."

[1556]- i.e., worship.

# 4764

So remind, [O Muḥammad], for you are not, by the favor of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.

# 4765
