# 5595

Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blaze.

# 5596

Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kāfūr,[1812]

[1812]- A sweet-smelling spring in Paradise.

# 5597

A spring of which the [righteous] servants of Allāh will drink; they will make it gush forth in force [and abundance].

# 5598

They [are those who] fulfill [their] vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.

# 5599

And they give food in spite of love for it[1813] to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,

[1813]- The meaning here may also be "out of love for Him," i.e., Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).

# 5600

[Saying], "We feed you only for the face [i.e., approval] of Allāh. We wish not from you reward or gratitude.

# 5601

Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful."

# 5602

So Allāh will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness

# 5603

And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments].

# 5604

[They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches. They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.

# 5605

And near above them are its shades, and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.

# 5606

And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],

# 5607

Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.

# 5608

And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger

# 5609

[From] a fountain within it [i.e., Paradise] named Salsabeel.

# 5610

There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.

# 5611

And when you look there [in Paradise], you will see pleasure and great dominion.

# 5612

Upon them [i.e., the inhabitants] will be green garments of fine silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.

# 5613

[And it will be said], "Indeed, this is for you a reward, and your effort has been appreciated."

# 5614

Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, [O Muḥammad], the Qur’ān progressively.

# 5615

So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].

# 5616

And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening

# 5617

And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt [i.e., praise] Him a long [part of the] night.

# 5618

Indeed, these [disbelievers] love the immediate and leave behind them[1814] a grave Day.

[1814]- i.e., neglect. The meaning may also be "leave ahead of them."

# 5619

We have created them and strengthened their forms, and when We will, We can change their likenesses with [complete] alteration.

# 5620

Indeed, this is a reminder, so he who wills may take to his Lord a way.

# 5621

And you do not will except that Allāh wills. Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

# 5622

He admits whom He wills into His mercy; but the wrongdoers - He has prepared for them a painful punishment.

# 5623

By those [winds] sent forth in gusts

# 5624

And the winds that blow violently

# 5625

And [by] the winds that spread [clouds]

# 5626

And those [angels] who bring criterion[1816]

[1816]- To Allāh's human messengers.

# 5627

And those [angels] who deliver a message

# 5628

As justification or warning,

# 5629

Indeed, what you are promised is to occur.

# 5630

So when the stars are obliterated

# 5631

And when the heaven is opened

# 5632

And when the mountains are blown away

# 5633

And when the messengers' time has come...[1817]

[1817]- i.e., when they are gathered to witness concerning their nations. The sentence's conclusion is understood to be "...the promised judgement will then take place."

# 5634

For what Day was it postponed?[1818]

[1818]- "It" may refer to either the aforementioned occurrences collectively or to the testimony of the messengers.

# 5635

For the Day of Judgement.

# 5636

And what can make you know what is the Day of Judgement?

# 5637

Woe,[1819] that Day, to the deniers.

[1819]- i.e., death and destruction.

# 5638

Did We not destroy the former peoples?

# 5639

Then We will follow them with the later ones.

# 5640

Thus do We deal with the criminals.

# 5641

Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

# 5642

Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?

# 5643

And We placed it in a firm lodging [i.e., the womb]

# 5644

For a known extent.

# 5645

And We determined [it], and excellent [are We] to determine.

# 5646

Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

# 5647

Have We not made the earth a container

# 5648

Of the living and the dead?

# 5649

And We placed therein lofty, firmly set mountains and have given you to drink sweet water.

# 5650

Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

# 5651

[They will be told], "Proceed to that which you used to deny.

# 5652

Proceed to a shadow [of smoke] having three columns

# 5653

[But having] no cool shade and availing not against the flame."

# 5654

Indeed, it throws sparks [as huge] as a fortress,

# 5655

As if they were yellowish [black] camels.

# 5656

Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

# 5657

This is a Day they will not speak,

# 5658

Nor will it be permitted for them to make an excuse.

# 5659

Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

# 5660

This is the Day of Judgement; We will have assembled you and the former peoples.

# 5661

So if you have a plan, then plan against Me.

# 5662

Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

# 5663

Indeed, the righteous will be among shades and springs

# 5664

And fruits from whatever they desire,

# 5665

[Being told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."

# 5666

Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

# 5667

Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

# 5668

[O disbelievers], eat and enjoy yourselves a little; indeed, you are criminals.

# 5669

Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

# 5670

And when it is said to them, "Bow [in prayer]," they do not bow.

# 5671

Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

# 5672

Then in what statement after it [i.e., the Qur’ān] will they believe?

# 5673

About what are they asking one another?

# 5674

About the great news[1821] -

[1821]- i.e., the Resurrection.

# 5675

That over which they are in disagreement.

# 5676

No! They are going to know.

# 5677

Then, no! They are going to know.

# 5678

Have We not made the earth a resting place?

# 5679

And the mountains as stakes?[1822]

[1822]- To stabilize the land and balance the earth.

# 5680

And We created you in pairs

# 5681

And made your sleep [a means for] rest

# 5682

And made the night as clothing[1823]

[1823]- Covering you in darkness and providing rest.

# 5683

And made the day for livelihood

# 5684

And constructed above you seven strong [heavens]

# 5685

And made [therein] a burning lamp

# 5686

And sent down from the rain clouds pouring water

# 5687

That We may bring forth thereby grain and vegetation

# 5688

And gardens of entwined growth.

# 5689

Indeed, the Day of Judgement is an appointed time -

# 5690

The Day the Horn is blown and you will come forth in multitudes

# 5691

And the heaven is opened and will become gateways

# 5692

And the mountains are removed and will be [but] a mirage.

# 5693

Indeed, Hell has been lying in wait

# 5694

For the transgressors, a place of return,

# 5695

In which they will remain for ages [unending].

# 5696

They will not taste therein [any] coolness or drink.

# 5697

Except scalding water and [foul] purulence -

# 5698

An appropriate recompense.[1824]

[1824]- In proportion to and comparable with their crimes.

# 5699

Indeed, they were not expecting an account

# 5700

And denied Our verses with [emphatic] denial.

# 5701

But all things We have enumerated in writing.

# 5702

"So taste [the penalty], and never will We increase you except in torment."[1825]

[1825]- This announcement will be made to the companions of Hell.

# 5703

Indeed, for the righteous is attainment[1826] -

[1826]- Of security, success and reward, including escape and safety from Hell.

# 5704

Gardens and grapevines

# 5705

And young women [companions] of equal age.

# 5706

And a full cup.[1827]

[1827]- Of wine which is delicious and does not intoxicate.

# 5707

No ill speech will they hear therein or any falsehood -

# 5708

[As] reward from your Lord, [a generous] gift [made due by] account,[1828]

[1828]- i.e., as a result of both their own righteous deeds and the limitless generosity of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) . Another meaning is "a gift calculated [to be adequate]."

# 5709

[From] the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Most Merciful. They possess not from Him [authority for] speech.[1829]

[1829]- None of Allāh's creatures can plead with Him on the Day of Judgement except by His permission.

# 5710

The Day that the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] and the angels will stand in rows, they will not speak except for one whom the Most Merciful permits, and he will say what is correct.

# 5711

That is the True [i.e., certain] Day; so he who wills may take to his Lord a [way of] return.[1830]

[1830]- i.e., a direct route through correct beliefs and righteous deeds.

# 5712

Indeed, We have warned you of an impending punishment on the Day when a man will observe what his hands have put forth[1831] and the disbeliever will say, "Oh, I wish that I were dust!"

[1831]- i.e., the deeds he did in this world, which await him in the Hereafter.

# 5713

By those [angels] who extract with violence[1833]

[1833]- i.e., those who tear out the souls of those destined for Hell.

# 5714

And [by] those who remove with ease[1834]

[1834]- i.e., those angels who ease out the souls of those destined for Paradise.

# 5715

And [by] those who glide [as if] swimming[1835]

[1835]- Speeding to execute Allāh's commands.

# 5716

And those who race each other in a race[1836]

[1836]- Racing to deliver the souls of the believers to Paradise.

# 5717

And those who arrange [each] matter,[1837]

[1837]- According to Allāh's decree.

# 5718

On the Day the blast [of the Horn] will convulse [creation],

# 5719

There will follow it the subsequent [one].

# 5720

Hearts,[1838] that Day, will tremble,

[1838]- Those of the disbelievers who denied the Resurrection.

# 5721

Their eyes[1839] humbled.

[1839]- Those of the disbelievers.

# 5722

They are [presently] saying, "Will we indeed be returned to [our] former state [of life]?

# 5723

Even if we should be decayed bones?"[1840]

[1840]- The disbelievers say this in ridicule of the warning.

# 5724

They say, "That, then, would be a losing return."[1841]

[1841]- i.e., "If that were so, we would not be able to escape punishment."

# 5725

Indeed, it will be but one shout,

# 5726

And suddenly they will be [alert] upon the earth's surface.

# 5727

Has there reached you the story of Moses? -

# 5728

When his Lord called to him in the sacred valley of Ṭuwā,

# 5729

"Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.

# 5730

And say to him, 'Would you [be willing to] purify yourself

# 5731

And let me guide you to your Lord so you would fear [Him]?'"

# 5732

And he showed him the greatest sign,[1842]

[1842]- i.e., the miracle of his staff becoming a great snake.

# 5733

But he [i.e., Pharaoh] denied and disobeyed.

# 5734

Then he turned his back, striving [i.e., plotting].[1843]

[1843]- An alternative meaning is "running [from the snake]."

# 5735

And he gathered [his people] and called out

# 5736

And said, "I am your most exalted lord."

# 5737

So Allāh seized him in exemplary punishment for the last and the first [transgression].[1844].

[1844]- i.e., for Pharaoh's setting himself up as a deity and for his previous oppression of the people and denial of Moses.

# 5738

Indeed in that is a lesson [i.e., warning] for whoever would fear [Allāh].

# 5739

Are you a more difficult creation or is the heaven? He [i.e., Allāh] constructed it.

# 5740

He raised its ceiling and proportioned it.

# 5741

And He darkened its night and extracted its brightness.[1845]

[1845]- i.e., created the day from within the surrounding darkness.

# 5742

And after that He spread the earth.

# 5743

He extracted from it its water and its pasture,

# 5744

And the mountains He set firmly

# 5745

As enjoyment [i.e., provision] for you and your grazing livestock.

# 5746

But when there comes the greatest Overwhelming Calamity[1846] -

[1846]- i.e., the Day of Resurrection.

# 5747

The Day when man will remember that for which he strove,

# 5748

And Hellfire will be exposed for [all] those who see -

# 5749

So as for he who transgressed

# 5750

And preferred the life of the world,

# 5751

Then indeed, Hellfire will be [his] refuge.

# 5752

But as for he who feared the position of his Lord[1847] and prevented the soul from [unlawful] inclination,

[1847]- See footnote to 55:46.

# 5753

Then indeed, Paradise will be [his] refuge.

# 5754

They ask you, [O Muḥammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival?[1848]

[1848]- Literally, "resting" or "establishment."

# 5755

In what [position] are you that you should mention it?[1849]

[1849]- Meaning that Muḥammad (صلى الله عليه وسلم) had no knowledge of it, so how could he inform them?

# 5756

To your Lord is its finality.[1850]

[1850]- i.e., its destination and termination. And to Him belongs ultimate knowledge of it.

# 5757

You are only a warner for those who fear it.

# 5758

It will be, on the Day they see it,[1851] as though they had not remained [in the world] except for an afternoon or a morning thereof.

[1851]- i.e., the Hour, the Resurrection.

# 5759

He [i.e., the Prophet (صلى الله عليه وسلم) ] frowned and turned away

# 5760

Because there came to him the blind man,[1853] [interrupting].

[1853]- ʿAbdullāh, the son of Umm Maktūm.

# 5761

But what would make you perceive, [O Muḥammad], that perhaps he might be purified[1854]

[1854]- As a result of what he learns from you.

# 5762

Or be reminded and the remembrance would benefit him?

# 5763

As for he who thinks himself without need,[1855]

[1855]- i.e., without need of faith or need of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) . Here it is in reference to a certain influential member of the Quraysh whom the Prophet (صلى الله عليه وسلم) had hoped to bring to Islām.

# 5764

To him you give attention.

# 5765

And not upon you [is any blame] if he will not be purified.[1856]

[1856]- The Prophet (صلى الله عليه وسلم) was responsible only for conveying the message, not for ultimate guidance.

# 5766

But as for he who came to you striving [for knowledge]

# 5767

While he fears [Allāh],

# 5768

From him you are distracted.

# 5769

No! Indeed, they [i.e., these verses] are a reminder;

# 5770

So whoever wills may remember it.[1857]

[1857]- The revelation. Or "Him," i.e., Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) .

# 5771

[It is recorded] in honored sheets,

# 5772

Exalted and purified,

# 5773

[Carried] by the hands of messenger-angels,

# 5774

Noble and dutiful.

# 5775

Destroyed [i.e., cursed] is man;[1858] how disbelieving is he.

[1858]- i.e., those who deny Allāh's message.

# 5776

From what thing [i.e., substance] did He create him?

# 5777

From a sperm-drop He created him and destined for him;[1859]

[1859]- His proportions, provisions, life span, etc.

# 5778

Then He eased the way for him;[1860]

[1860]- Into this world (i.e., his birth) . It may also refer to life itself, which has been made easier by Allāh's guidance.

# 5779

Then He causes his death and provides a grave for him.[1861]

[1861]- To conceal his decaying body.

# 5780

Then when He wills, He will resurrect him.

# 5781

No! He [i.e., man] has not yet accomplished what He commanded him.

# 5782

Then let mankind look at his food -

# 5783

How We poured down water in torrents,

# 5784

Then We broke open the earth, splitting [it with sprouts],

# 5785

And caused to grow within it grain

# 5786

And grapes and herbage

# 5787

And olive and palm trees

# 5788

And gardens of dense shrubbery

# 5789

And fruit and grass -

# 5790

[As] enjoyment [i.e., provision] for you and your grazing livestock.

# 5791

But when there comes the Deafening Blast[1862]

[1862]- The piercing blast of the Horn which signals resurrection. Aṣ-Ṣākhkhah is also a name for the Day of Resurrection.

# 5792

On the Day a man will flee from his brother

# 5793

And his mother and his father

# 5794

And his wife and his children,

# 5795

For every man, that Day, will be a matter adequate for him.[1863]

[1863]- i.e., to occupy him. He will be concerned only with himself, thus forgetting all others.

# 5796

[Some] faces, that Day, will be bright -

# 5797

Laughing, rejoicing at good news.

# 5798

And [other] faces, that Day, will have upon them dust.

# 5799

Blackness will cover them.

# 5800

Those are the disbelievers, the wicked ones.

# 5801

When the sun is wrapped up [in darkness]

# 5802

And when the stars fall, dispersing,

# 5803

And when the mountains are removed

# 5804

And when full-term she-camels[1865] are neglected

[1865]- Those ten months pregnant and nearing delivery. This verse alludes to distraction from the most valued of possessions.

# 5805

And when the wild beasts are gathered

# 5806

And when the seas are filled with flame[1866]

[1866]- Or "when the seas have overflowed [into each other]."

# 5807

And when the souls are paired[1867]

[1867]- With another like soul. It can also mean "joined" (with their groups or sects) .

# 5808

And when the girl [who was] buried alive is asked

# 5809

For what sin she was killed

# 5810

And when the pages[1868] are spread [i.e., made public]

[1868]- On which are recorded the deeds of all people.

# 5811

And when the sky is stripped away

# 5812

And when Hellfire is set ablaze

# 5813

And when Paradise is brought near,

# 5814

A soul will [then] know what it has brought [with it].[1869]

[1869]- i.e., all of one's deeds from worldly life, which have accompanied the soul to the Hereafter.

# 5815

So I swear by the retreating stars -

# 5816

Those that run [their courses] and disappear [i.e., set]

# 5817

And by the night as it closes in[1870]

[1870]- An alternative meaning is "as it departs."

# 5818

And by the dawn when it breathes [i.e., stirs]

# 5819

[That] indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a word [conveyed by] a noble messenger [i.e., Gabriel]

# 5820

[Who is] possessed of power and with the Owner of the Throne, secure [in position],

# 5821

Obeyed there [in the heavens] and trustworthy.

# 5822

And your companion [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (صلى الله عليه وسلم) ] is not [at all] mad.[1871]

[1871]- Literally, "possessed by jinn."

# 5823

And he has already seen him [i.e., Gabriel] in the clear horizon.[1872]

[1872]- i.e., the eastern horizon, where the sun rises. See footnote to 53:6.

# 5824

And he [i.e., Muḥammad (صلى الله عليه وسلم)] is not a withholder of [knowledge of] the unseen.[1873]

[1873]- Prophet Muḥammad (صلى الله عليه وسلم) did not withhold that knowledge of the unseen which Allāh had revealed to him in the Qur’ān.

# 5825

And it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is not the word of a devil, expelled [from the heavens].

# 5826

So where are you going?[1874]

[1874]- In your denial of the Qur’ān and in your accusations against the Prophet (صلى الله عليه وسلم) . The meaning is essentially "Surely, you have strayed far from Allāh's path."

# 5827

It is not except a reminder to the worlds

# 5828

For whoever wills among you to take a right course.

# 5829

And you do not will except that Allāh wills - Lord of the worlds.

# 5830

When the sky breaks apart

# 5831

And when the stars fall, scattering,

# 5832

And when the seas are erupted

# 5833

And when the [contents of] graves are scattered [i.e., exposed],

# 5834

A soul will [then] know what it has put forth and kept back.

# 5835

O mankind, what has deceived you concerning your Lord, the Generous,

# 5836

Who created you, proportioned you, and balanced you?

# 5837

In whatever form He willed has He assembled you.

# 5838

No! But you deny the Recompense.

# 5839

And indeed, [appointed] over you are keepers,[1876]

[1876]- Angels who preserve the deeds of men in records.

# 5840

Noble and recording;

# 5841

They know whatever you do.

# 5842

Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure,

# 5843

And indeed, the wicked will be in Hellfire.

# 5844

They will [enter to] burn therein on the Day of Recompense,

# 5845

And never therefrom will they be absent.

# 5846

And what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?

# 5847

Then, what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?

# 5848

It is the Day when a soul will not possess for another soul [power to do] a thing; and the command, that Day, is [entirely] with Allāh.

# 5849

Woe to those who give less [than due],[1878]

[1878]- i.e., those who cheat people by giving them less than what they paid for when weighing or measuring - an amount so little as to hardly be noticed.

# 5850

Who, when they take a measure from people, take in full.

# 5851

But if they give by measure or by weight to them, they cause loss.

# 5852

Do they not think that they will be resurrected

# 5853

For a tremendous Day -

# 5854

The Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds?

# 5855

No! Indeed, the record of the wicked is in sijjeen.

# 5856

And what can make you know what is sijjeen?

# 5857

It is [their destination[1879] recorded in] a register inscribed.

[1879]- The lowest depths of Hell.

# 5858

Woe, that Day, to the deniers,

# 5859

Who deny the Day of Recompense.

# 5860

And none deny it except every sinful transgressor.

# 5861

When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."

# 5862

No! Rather, the stain has covered their hearts of that which they were earning.[1880]

[1880]- i.e., their sins.

# 5863

No! Indeed, from their Lord, that Day, they will be partitioned.[1881]

[1881]- i.e., they will not be able to see Him.

# 5864

Then indeed, they will [enter and] burn in Hellfire.

# 5865

Then it will be said [to them], "This is what you used to deny."

# 5866

No! Indeed, the record of the righteous is in ʿilliyyūn.

# 5867

And what can make you know what is ʿilliyyūn?

# 5868

It is [their destination[1882] recorded in] a register inscribed

[1882]- The highest elevations of Paradise.

# 5869

Which is witnessed by those brought near [to Allāh].

# 5870

Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure

# 5871

On adorned couches, observing.

# 5872

You will recognize in their faces the radiance of pleasure.

# 5873

They will be given to drink [pure] wine[1883] [which was] sealed.

[1883]- Which is delicious and does not intoxicate.

# 5874

The last of it[1884] is musk. So for this let the competitors compete.

[1884]- i.e., its lingering odor.

# 5875

And its mixture is of Tasneem,[1885]

[1885]- The highest spring in Paradise and the most favored drink of its inhabitants.

# 5876

A spring from which those near [to Allāh] drink.

# 5877

Indeed, those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.

# 5878

And when they passed by them, they would exchange derisive glances.

# 5879

And when they returned to their people, they would return jesting.

# 5880

And when they saw them, they would say, "Indeed, those are truly lost."

# 5881

But they had not been sent as guardians over them.

# 5882

So Today[1886] those who believed are laughing at the disbelievers,

[1886]- On the Day of Judgement.

# 5883

On adorned couches, observing.

# 5884

Have the disbelievers [not] been rewarded [this Day] for what they used to do?

# 5885

When the sky has split [open]

# 5886

And has listened [i.e., responded][1888] to its Lord and was obligated [to do so]

[1888]- It will have heard Allāh's command and will have inclined immediately to compliance and willing obedience.

# 5887

And when the earth has been extended[1889]

[1889]- i.e., stretched flat and spread out.

# 5888

And has cast out that within it[1890] and relinquished [it]

[1890]- Of the dead and all else buried therein.

# 5889

And has listened [i.e., responded] to its Lord and was obligated [to do so] –

# 5890

O mankind, indeed you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion[1891] and will meet it.[1892]

[1891]- i.e., striving throughout your life until you meet your Lord, hastening toward death.
[1892]- i.e., you will find all that you intended and accomplished awaiting you in the Hereafter. Another meaning is "And will meet Him [i.e., your Lord]" and be recompensed in full by Him.

# 5891

Then as for he who is given his record in his right hand,

# 5892

He will be judged with an easy account

# 5893

And return to his people in happiness.

# 5894

But as for he who is given his record behind his back,

# 5895

He will cry out for destruction

# 5896

And [enter to] burn in a Blaze.

# 5897

Indeed, he had [once] been among his people in happiness;

# 5898

Indeed, he had thought he would never return [to Allāh].

# 5899

But yes! Indeed, his Lord was ever, of him, Seeing.

# 5900

So I swear by the twilight glow

# 5901

And [by] the night and what it envelops

# 5902

And [by] the moon when it becomes full

# 5903

[That] you will surely embark upon [i.e., experience] state after state.[1893]

[1893]- i.e., various stages, both in this life and in the Hereafter.

# 5904

So what is [the matter] with them [that] they do not believe,

# 5905

And when the Qur’ān is recited to them, they do not prostrate [to Allāh]?

# 5906

But those who have disbelieved deny,

# 5907

And Allāh is most knowing of what they keep within themselves.

# 5908

So give them tidings of a painful punishment,

# 5909

Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds. For them is a reward uninterrupted.

# 5910

By the sky containing great stars

# 5911

And [by] the promised Day

# 5912

And [by] the witness and what is witnessed,

# 5913

Destroyed [i.e., cursed] were the companions of the trench[1895]

[1895]- Or "May they be destroyed" or "cursed." The "companions of the trench" (or ditch) were agents of a tyrannical king who refused to allow his people to believe in Allāh. Their evil deed in obedience to their ruler earned for them the curse of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) .

# 5914

[Containing] the fire full of fuel,

# 5915

When they were sitting near it.

# 5916

And they, to what they were doing against the believers, were witnesses. [1896]

[1896]- After casting the believers into a trench filled with fire, they sat at its edge, watching them burn to death. This event occurred before the time of Prophet Muḥammad (صلى الله عليه وسلم) .

# 5917

And they resented them not except because they believed in Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy,

# 5918

To whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And Allāh, over all things, is Witness.[1897]

[1897]- See footnote to 4:79.

# 5919

Indeed, those who have tortured[1898] the believing men and believing women and then have not repented will have the punishment of Hell, and they will have the punishment of the Burning Fire.

[1898]- Or, in this instance, the literal meaning of "burned" is also appropriate.

# 5920

Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great attainment.

# 5921

Indeed, the assault [i.e., vengeance] of your Lord is severe.

# 5922

Indeed, it is He who originates [creation] and repeats.

# 5923

And He is the Forgiving, the Affectionate,

# 5924

Honorable Owner of the Throne,

# 5925

Effecter of what He intends.

# 5926

Has there reached you the story of the soldiers -

# 5927

[Those of] Pharaoh and Thamūd?

# 5928

But they who disbelieve are in [persistent] denial,

# 5929

While Allāh encompasses them from behind.[1899]

[1899]- See footnote to 2:19

# 5930

But this is an honored Qur’ān

# 5931

[Inscribed] in a Preserved Slate.

# 5932

By the sky and the knocker

# 5933

And what can make you know what is the knocker?

# 5934

It is the piercing star[1901].

[1901]- Whose light pierces through the darkness.

# 5935

There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.

# 5936

So let man observe from what he was created.

# 5937

He was created from a fluid, ejected,

# 5938

Emerging from between the backbone and the ribs.

# 5939

Indeed, He [i.e., Allāh], to return him [to life], is Able.

# 5940

The Day when secrets will be put on trial,[1902]

[1902]- i.e., exposed, examined and judged.

# 5941

Then he [i.e., man] will have no power or any helper.

# 5942

By the sky which sends back[1903]

[1903]- Rain, heat, sound waves, etc.

# 5943

And [by] the earth which splits,[1904]

[1904]- With plant growth or from geological rifts.

# 5944

Indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a decisive statement,

# 5945

And it is not amusement.

# 5946

Indeed, they are planning a plan,

# 5947

But I am planning a plan.

# 5948

So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile.[1905]

[1905]- i.e., Do not be in haste for revenge, for you will see what will become of them.

# 5949

Exalt the name of your Lord, the Most High,

# 5950

Who created and proportioned

# 5951

And who destined and [then] guided

# 5952

And who brings out the pasture

# 5953

And [then] makes it black stubble.

# 5954

We will make you recite, [O Muḥammad], and you will not forget,

# 5955

Except what Allāh should will. Indeed, He knows what is declared and what is hidden.

# 5956

And We will ease you toward ease.[1907]

[1907]- To the path of Allāh's religion, which is easy and natural, or toward Paradise, by giving opportunities for righteous deeds.

# 5957

So remind, if the reminder should benefit;[1908]

[1908]- i.e., wherever it will be heard and understood.

# 5958

He who fears [Allāh] will be reminded.

# 5959

But the wretched one will avoid it –

# 5960

[He] who will [enter and] burn in the greatest Fire,

# 5961

Neither dying therein nor living.

# 5962

He has certainly succeeded who purifies himself

# 5963

And mentions the name of his Lord and prays.

# 5964

But you prefer the worldly life,

# 5965

While the Hereafter is better and more enduring.

# 5966

Indeed, this is in the former scriptures,

# 5967

The scriptures of Abraham and Moses.

# 5968

Has there reached you the report of the Overwhelming [event]?

# 5969

[Some] faces, that Day, will be humbled,

# 5970

Working [hard] and exhausted.[1910]

[1910]- Another accepted meaning is "They were working hard and exhausted," i.e., doing deeds during worldly life which did not benefit them since they were not accompanied by faith or done for the acceptance of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) .

# 5971

They will [enter to] burn in an intensely hot Fire.

# 5972

They will be given drink from a boiling spring.

# 5973

For them there will be no food except from a poisonous, thorny plant

# 5974

Which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger.

# 5975

[Other] faces, that Day, will show pleasure.

# 5976

With their effort [they are] satisfied

# 5977

In an elevated garden,

# 5978

Wherein they will hear no unsuitable speech.[1911]

[1911]- i.e., any insult, falsehood, immorality, idle or vain talk, etc.

# 5979

Within it is a flowing spring.

# 5980

Within it are couches raised high

# 5981

And cups put in place

# 5982

And cushions lined up

# 5983

And carpets spread around.

# 5984

Then do they not look at the camels - how they are created?

# 5985

And at the sky - how it is raised?

# 5986

And at the mountains - how they are erected?

# 5987

And at the earth - how it is spread out?

# 5988

So remind, [O Muḥammad]; you are only a reminder.

# 5989

You are not over them a controller.

# 5990

However, he who turns away and disbelieves –

# 5991

Then Allāh will punish him with the greatest punishment.

# 5992

Indeed, to Us is their return.

# 5993

Then indeed, upon Us is their account.

# 5994

By the dawn

# 5995

And [by] ten nights[1913]

[1913]- Usually interpreted as the first ten nights of the month of Dhul-Ḥijjah.

# 5996

And [by] the even [number] and the odd

# 5997

And [by] the night when it passes,

# 5998

Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?[1914]

[1914]- Based upon the following verses, what has been sworn to by Allāh is that He will certainly punish the disbelievers.

# 5999

Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with ʿAad -

# 6000

[With] Iram[1915] - who had lofty pillars,[1916]

[1915]- Another name for the first people of ʿAad, to whom Prophet Hūd was sent.
[1916]- Supporting their tents or buildings.

# 6001

The likes of whom had never been created in the land?

# 6002

And [with] Thamūd, who carved out the rocks in the valley?

# 6003

And [with] Pharaoh, owner of the stakes?[1917]

[1917]- By which he tortured people.

# 6004

[All of] whom oppressed within the lands

# 6005

And increased therein the corruption.

# 6006

So your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.

# 6007

Indeed, your Lord is in observation.

# 6008

And as for man, when his Lord tries him and [thus] is generous to him and favors him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."[1918]

[1918]- He is proud rather than grateful, attributing the favor to his own merit.

# 6009

But when He tries him and restricts his provision, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me."

# 6010

No![1919] But you do not honor the orphan

[1919]- It is not like you imagine. Rather, Allāh tries people through prosperity and hardship and rewards both gratitude and patience with honor in the Hereafter.

# 6011

And you do not encourage one another to feed the poor.

# 6012

And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,[1920]

[1920]- Not caring whether it is lawful or unlawful.

# 6013

And you love wealth with immense love.

# 6014

No! When the earth has been leveled - pounded and crushed

# 6015

And your Lord has come[1921] and the angels, rank upon rank,

[1921]- To pass judgement. See footnote to 2:19.

# 6016

And brought [within view], that Day, is Hell - that Day, man will remember, but how [i.e., what good] to him will be the remembrance?

# 6017

He will say, "Oh, I wish I had sent ahead [some good] for my life."[1922]

[1922]- The everlasting life of the Hereafter.

# 6018

So on that Day, none will punish [as severely] as His punishment,

# 6019

And none will bind [as severely] as His binding [of the evildoers].

# 6020

[To the righteous it will be said], "O reassured soul,

# 6021

Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],

# 6022

And enter among My [righteous] servants

# 6023

And enter My Paradise."

# 6024

I swear by this city [i.e., Makkah] –

# 6025

And you, [O Muḥammad], are free of restriction in this city –

# 6026

And [by] the father[1924] and that which was born [of him],

[1924]- Said to be Adam (upon him be peace) .

# 6027

We have certainly created man into hardship.

# 6028

Does he think that never will anyone overcome him?

# 6029

He says, "I have spent wealth in abundance."

# 6030

Does he think that no one has seen him?

# 6031

Have We not made for him two eyes?

# 6032

And a tongue and two lips?

# 6033

And have shown him the two ways?[1925]

[1925]- Of good and evil.

# 6034

But he has not broken through the difficult pass.[1926]

[1926]- i.e., the steep incline or obstacle. In other words, he has not spent in the cause of Allāh but only boasts of spending in front of others.

# 6035

And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?

# 6036

It is the freeing of a slave

# 6037

Or feeding on a day of severe hunger

# 6038

An orphan of near relationship

# 6039

Or a needy person in misery

# 6040

And then being among those who believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion.

# 6041

Those are the companions of the right.[1927]

[1927]- Or "the companions of good fortune," i.e., those who receive their records in their right hands and proceed to Paradise.

# 6042

But they who disbelieved in Our signs - those are the companions of the left.[1928]

[1928]- Or "the companions of ill fortune," i.e., those who receive their records in their left hands and proceed to Hell.

# 6043

Over them will be fire closed in.[1929]

[1929]- The cover over Hell will be sealed and locked, containing its fire and its inhabitants.

# 6044

By the sun and its brightness

# 6045

And [by] the moon when it follows it

# 6046

And [by] the day when it displays it[1931]

[1931]- The earth. Also interpreted as the sun. The same applies to the following verse.

# 6047

And [by] the night when it covers [i.e., conceals] it

# 6048

And [by] the sky and He who constructed it

# 6049

And [by] the earth and He who spread it

# 6050

And [by] the soul and He who proportioned it[1932]

[1932]- i.e., balanced and refined it, creating in it sound tendencies and consciousness.

# 6051

And inspired it [with discernment of] its wickedness and its righteousness,

# 6052

He has succeeded who purifies it,

# 6053

And he has failed who instills it [with corruption].

# 6054

Thamūd denied [their prophet] by reason of their transgression,

# 6055

When the most wretched of them was sent forth.[1933]

[1933]- To hamstring the she-camel which had been sent by Allāh as a sign to them.

# 6056

And the messenger of Allāh [i.e., Ṣāliḥ] said to them, "[Do not harm] the she-camel of Allāh or [prevent her from] her drink."

# 6057

But they denied him and hamstrung[1934] her. So their Lord brought down upon them destruction for their sin and made it equal [upon all of them].

[1934]- And then killed.

# 6058

And He does not fear the consequence thereof.[1935]

[1935]- Allāh is not asked about what He does, but His servants will be asked. See 21:23.

# 6059

By the night when it covers[1937]

[1937]- With darkness.

# 6060

And [by] the day when it appears

# 6061

And [by] He who created the male and female,

# 6062

Indeed, your efforts are diverse.

# 6063

As for he who gives and fears Allāh

# 6064

And believes in the best [reward].

# 6065

We will ease him toward ease.

# 6066

But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need

# 6067

And denies the best [reward],

# 6068

We will ease him toward difficulty.

# 6069

And what will his wealth avail him when he falls?[1938]

[1938]- i.e., when he dies or is destroyed. It can also mean when he falls into the Hellfire.

# 6070

Indeed, [incumbent] upon Us is guidance.

# 6071

And indeed, to us belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].

# 6072

So I have warned you of a Fire which is blazing.

# 6073

None will [enter to] burn therein except the most wretched one

# 6074

Who had denied and turned away.

# 6075

But the righteous one will avoid it –

# 6076

[He] who gives [from] his wealth to purify himself

# 6077

And not [giving] for anyone who has [done him] a favor to be rewarded[1939] –

[1939]- i.e., without intending reciprocation for some benefit to himself.

# 6078

But only seeking the face [i.e., acceptance] of his Lord, Most High.

# 6079

And he is going to be satisfied.

# 6080

By the morning brightness

# 6081

And [by] the night when it covers with darkness,[1941]

[1941]- And becomes still.

# 6082

Your Lord has not taken leave of you, [O Muḥammad], nor has He detested [you].

# 6083

And the Hereafter is better for you than the first [life].

# 6084

And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.

# 6085

Did He not find you an orphan and give [you] refuge?

# 6086

And He found you lost and guided [you],

# 6087

And He found you poor and made [you] self-sufficient.

# 6088

So as for the orphan, do not oppress [him].

# 6089

And as for the petitioner,[1942] do not repel [him].

[1942]- Anyone who seeks aid or knowledge.

# 6090

But as for the favor of your Lord, report [it].

# 6091

Did We not expand for you, [O Muḥammad], your breast?[1944]

[1944]- i.e., enlighten, assure and gladden your heart with guidance.

# 6092

And We removed from you your burden[1945]

[1945]- By forgiving any errors which you may have committed previously or might commit consequently. "Burden" can also refer to the anxiety experienced by the Prophet (صلى الله عليه وسلم) at the beginning of his mission.

# 6093

Which had weighed upon your back

# 6094

And raised high for you your repute.

# 6095

For indeed, with hardship [will be] ease [i.e., relief].

# 6096

Indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.

# 6097

So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship].

# 6098

And to your Lord direct [your] longing.

# 6099

By the fig and the olive[1947]

[1947]- Referring to the places known for their production, i.e., Damascus and Jerusalem, respectively. It could also refer to the fig and olive trees or to the fruits themselves.

# 6100

And [by] Mount Sinai

# 6101

And [by] this secure city [i.e., Makkah],

# 6102

We have certainly created man in the best of stature;[1948]

[1948]- i.e., upright, symmetrical, and balanced in form and nature.

# 6103

Then We return him to the lowest of the low,[1949]

[1949]- This can refer to the depths of Hell, to decrepit old age or to immorality.

# 6104

Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward uninterrupted.

# 6105

So what yet causes you to deny the Recompense?[1950]

[1950]- More literally, "What makes you lie concerning it?"

# 6106

Is not Allāh the most just of judges?

# 6107

Recite in the name of your Lord who created –

# 6108

Created man from a clinging substance.

# 6109

Recite, and your Lord is the most Generous -

# 6110

Who taught by the pen –

# 6111

Taught man that which he knew not.

# 6112

No! [But] indeed, man transgresses

# 6113

Because he sees himself self-sufficient.

# 6114

Indeed, to your Lord is the return.

# 6115

Have you seen the one who forbids

# 6116

A servant when he prays?

# 6117

Have you seen if he is upon guidance

# 6118

Or enjoins righteousness?

# 6119

Have you seen if he denies and turns away -

# 6120

Does he not know that Allāh sees?

# 6121

No! If he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock[1952] –

[1952]- It may also mean "slap him" or "blacken his face at the forelock."

# 6122

A lying, sinning forelock.

# 6123

Then let him call his associates;

# 6124

We will call the angels of Hell.[1953]

[1953]- Those who push the wicked into the Fire.

# 6125

No! Do not obey him. But prostrate and draw near [to Allāh].

# 6126

Indeed, We sent it [i.e., the Qur’ān] down during the Night of Decree.

# 6127

And what can make you know what is the Night of Decree?

# 6128

The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.

# 6129

The angels and the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] descend therein by permission of their Lord for every matter.[1955]

[1955]- Bringing the exact measures apportioned for everything by Allāh in the course of the coming year.

# 6130

Peace it is[1956] until the emergence of dawn.

[1956]- Upon the believers.

# 6131

Those who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists were not to be parted [from misbelief][1958] until there came to them clear evidence –

[1958]- i.e., from their erroneous beliefs and superstitions.

# 6132

A Messenger from Allāh, reciting purified[1959] scriptures

[1959]- i.e., containing no falsehood.

# 6133

Within which are correct writings [i.e., rulings and laws].

# 6134

[1960]- Into sects and denominations.

# 6135

And they were not commanded except to worship Allāh, [being] sincere to Him in religion, inclining to truth, and to establish prayer and to give zakāh. And that is the correct religion.

# 6136

Indeed, they who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists will be in the fire of Hell, abiding eternally therein. Those are the worst of creatures.

# 6137

Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds - those are the best of creatures.

# 6138

Their reward with their Lord will be gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever, Allāh being pleased with them and they with Him. That is for whoever has feared his Lord.

# 6139

When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake

# 6140

And the earth discharges its burdens[1962]

[1962]- See verse 84:4.

# 6141

And man says,[1963] "What is [wrong] with it?" -

[1963]- In terror and amazement.

# 6142

That Day, it will report its news

# 6143

Because your Lord has inspired [i.e., commanded] it.

# 6144

That Day, the people will depart[1964] separated [into categories] to be shown [the result of] their deeds.

[1964]- From the place of Judgement to their final abode. Another interpretation is "emerge separately" (from the graves) .

# 6145

So whoever does an atom's weight[1965] of good will see it,

[1965]- Or "the weight of a small ant."

# 6146

And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.

# 6147

By the racers, panting,[1967]

[1967]- i.e., the horses bearing riders as they race to attack the enemy.

# 6148

And the producers of sparks [when] striking[1968]

[1968]- Their hoofs while galloping over rocky terrain.

# 6149

And the chargers at dawn,[1969]

[1969]- While the enemy is unaware.

# 6150

Stirring up thereby [clouds of] dust,

# 6151

Arriving thereby in the center[1970] collectively,

[1970]- i.e., penetrating into the enemy ranks during a surprise attack.

# 6152

Indeed mankind, to his Lord, is ungrateful.

# 6153

And indeed, he is to that a witness.[1971]

[1971]- Through his speech and his actions.

# 6154

And indeed he is, in love of wealth, intense.

# 6155

But does he not know that when the contents of the graves are scattered

# 6156

And that within the breasts is obtained,[1972]

[1972]- i.e., when all secrets are made known.

# 6157

Indeed, their Lord with them, that Day, is [fully] Aware.[1973]

[1973]- Fully acquainted and familiar with everything about each one of them.

# 6158

The Striking Calamity -

# 6159

What is the Striking Calamity?

# 6160

And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?

# 6161

It is the Day when people will be like moths, dispersed,[1975]

[1975]- The people will be as such after having been expelled from their graves.

# 6162

And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up.[1976]

[1976]- i.e., beginning to disintegrate.

# 6163

Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds],

# 6164

He will be in a pleasant life.

# 6165

But as for one whose scales are light,

# 6166

His refuge[1977] will be an abyss.[1978]

[1977]- Literally, "mother" (a man's original refuge) , which will envelop him as in an embrace.
[1978]- i.e., the pit of Hellfire.

# 6167

And what can make you know what that is?

# 6168

It is a Fire, intensely hot.

# 6169

Competition in [worldly] increase diverts you

# 6170

Until you visit the graveyards.[1980]

[1980]- i.e., remain in them temporarily, meaning until the Day of Resurrection.

# 6171

No! You are going to know.

# 6172

Then, no! You are going to know.

# 6173

No! If you only knew with knowledge of certainty...[1981]

[1981]- The conclusion of this verse is estimated to be "...you would not have been distracted from preparing for the Hereafter."

# 6174

You will surely see the Hellfire.

# 6175

Then you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.[1982]

[1982]- i.e., with actual eyesight.

# 6176

Then you will surely be asked that Day about pleasure.[1983]

[1983]- i.e., the comforts of worldly life and whether you were grateful to Allāh for His blessings.

# 6177

By time,[1985]

[1985]- An oath in which Allāh swears by time throughout the ages.

# 6178

Indeed, mankind is in loss,

# 6179

Except for those who have believed and done righteous deeds and advised each other to truth and advised each other to patience.

# 6180

Woe to every scorner and mocker

# 6181

Who collects wealth and [continuously] counts it.[1987]

[1987]- Rather than spending in the way of Allāh.

# 6182

He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.

# 6183

No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.[1988]

[1988]- i.e., Hellfire, which crushes and destroys all that enters it.

# 6184

And what can make you know what is the Crusher?

# 6185

It is the fire of Allāh, [eternally] fueled,

# 6186

Which mounts directed at the hearts.[1989]

[1989]- Covering them and penetrating them.

# 6187

Indeed, it [i.e., Hellfire] will be closed down upon them

# 6188

In extended columns.[1990]

[1990]- Interpreted to be either columns of fire or columns of iron to which are chained the inmates of Hell.

# 6189

Have you not considered, [O Muḥammad], how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant?[1992]

[1992]- i.e., the army under the command of Abrahah al-Ashram which was accompanied by a huge elephant and came with the intention of destroying the Kaʿbah at Makkah.

# 6190

Did He not make their plan into misguidance?[1993]

[1993]- Causing them to perish.

# 6191

And He sent against them birds in flocks,

# 6192

Striking them with stones of hard clay,

# 6193

And He made them like eaten straw.[1994]

[1994]- i.e., husks which have been chewed by cattle. This event took place in the year of the Prophet's birth.

# 6194

For the accustomed security of the Quraysh[1996] -

[1996]- i.e., the honor and reputation Allāh had given them as guardians of the Holy Kaʿbah, which allowed them to travel without fear of being harmed.

# 6195

Their accustomed security [in] the caravan of winter and summer[1997] -

[1997]- i.e., the trading caravans that traveled south in winter and north in summer.

# 6196

Let them worship the Lord of this House,[1998]

[1998]- i.e., the Kaʿbah.

# 6197

Who has fed them, [saving them] from hunger and made them safe, [saving them] from fear.

# 6198

Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?

# 6199

For that is the one who drives away the orphan

# 6200

And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.

# 6201

So woe to those who pray

# 6202

[But] who are heedless of their prayer[2000] -

[2000]- i.e., the hypocrites who are unconcerned if they miss prayers when no one sees them.

# 6203

Those who make show [of their deeds]

# 6204

And withhold [simple] assistance.

# 6205

Indeed, We have granted you, [O Muḥammad], al-Kawthar.

# 6206

So pray to your Lord and offer sacrifice [to Him alone].

# 6207

Indeed, your enemy is the one cut off.[2002]

[2002]- From all good in this world and the Hereafter.

# 6208

Say, "O disbelievers,

# 6209

I do not worship what you worship.

# 6210

Nor are you worshippers of what I worship.

# 6211

Nor will I be a worshipper of what you worship.

# 6212

Nor will you be worshippers of what I worship.

# 6213

For you is your religion, and for me is my religion."

# 6214

When the victory of Allāh has come and the conquest,[2005]

[2005]- The conquest of Makkah.

# 6215

And you see the people entering into the religion of Allāh in multitudes,

# 6216

Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord and ask forgiveness of Him. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of Repentance.[2006]

[2006]- Refer to footnote of 2:37.

# 6217

May the hands of Abū Lahab be ruined, and ruined is he.[2008]

[2008]- Abū Lahab (the Prophet's uncle) , who was an enemy of Islām.

# 6218

His wealth will not avail him or that which he gained.

# 6219

He will [enter to] burn in a Fire of [blazing] flame

# 6220

And his wife [as well] - the carrier of firewood.[2009]

[2009]- She used to put thorns in the Prophet's path and slander him (صلى الله عليه وسلم) . The word "firewood" was used by the Arabs to allude to slander and backbiting.

# 6221

Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber.

# 6222

Say, "He is Allāh, [who is] One,[2011]

[2011]- Alone, without another, indivisible with absolute and permanent unity and distinct from all else. The one and only true deity, unique in His essence, attributes and deeds.

# 6223

Allāh, the Eternal Refuge.[2012]

[2012]- He who is absolute, perfect, complete, essential, self-sufficient and sufficient to meet the needs of all creation; the one eternally and constantly required and sought, depended upon by all existence and to whom all matters will ultimately return.

# 6224

He neither begets nor is born,

# 6225

Nor is there to Him any equivalent."

# 6226

Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak

# 6227

From the evil of that which He created

# 6228

And from the evil of darkness when it settles

# 6229

And from the evil of the blowers in knots[2014]

[2014]- i.e., those who practice magic.

# 6230

And from the evil of an envier when he envies."

# 6231

Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind,

# 6232

The Sovereign of mankind,

# 6233

The God of mankind,

# 6234

From the evil of the retreating whisperer[2016] -

[2016]- i.e., a devil who makes evil suggestions to man but disappears when one remembers Allāh.

# 6235

Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind -

# 6236

From among the jinn and mankind."[2017]

[2017]- Evil prompters may be from men as well as from jinn.
